19 bÃ­ kÃ­p vá»›i Github

BÃ i viáº¿t Ä‘Æ°á»£c dá»‹ch tá»« bÃ i Gitã§ã‚„ã‚‰ã‹ã—ãŸæ™‚ã«ä½¿ãˆã‚‹19å€‹ã®å¥¥ç¾© cá»§a tÃ¡c giáº£ muran001 trÃªn Qiita.

(Image Source: Medium)

Nhá»¯ng ná»™i dung sau ráº¥t nguy hiá»ƒm, náº¿u báº¡n lÃ m theo, xin hÃ£y chá»‹u trÃ¡ch nhiá»‡m vá» báº£n thÃ¢n mÃ¬nh.

Náº¿u cÃ³ gÃ¬ sai sÃ³t, mong báº¡n hÃ£y chá»‰ ra Ä‘á»ƒ tÃ´i Ä‘Æ°á»£c biáº¿t

á» trÃªn local

CÃ³ hiá»‡u quáº£ khi lÃ m viá»‡c trÃªn mÃ´i truá»ng phÃ¡t triá»ƒn cá»§a báº£n thÃ¢n, khÃ´ng lÃ m áº£nh hÆ°á»Ÿng Ä‘áº¿n ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c. Khi lÃ m viá»‡c trÃªn remote sáº½ phÃ¡t sinh áº£nh hÆ°á»Ÿng Ä‘áº¿n ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c nÃªn ráº¥t nguy hiá»ƒm.

Sá»± cá»‘ 1ï¼š Khi trong commit message lá»¡ cÃ³ nhá»¯ng tá»« cáº¥m ká»‹ khiáº¿n báº¡n chá»‰ muá»‘n cháº¿t Ä‘i cho xong

Äá»ƒ sá»­a láº¡i ná»™i dung commit thÃ¬ ráº¥t Ä‘Æ¡n giáº£n. CÅ©ng cÃ³ thá»ƒ thÃªm Ä‘Æ°á»£c cáº£ file vÃ o trong commit

$ git commit --amend # Sau lá»‡nh nÃ y ta cÃ³ thá»ƒ thay Ä‘á»•i ná»™i dung commit message má»™t cÃ¡ch tuá»³ Ã½

Sá»± cá»‘ 2ï¼š Khi lá»¡ tay commit dÆ°á»›i tÃªn cá»§a mÃ´t user khÃ¡c

Khi lÃ m viá»‡c á»Ÿ nhÃ  vÃ  khi lÃ m viá»‡c trÃªn cÃ´ng ty thÃ¬ háº³n sáº½ cÃ³ lÃºc sá»­ dung git config khÃ¡c nhau vÃ  cÅ©ng cÃ³ lÃºc bá»‹ nháº§m thiáº¿t láº­p.

á» Ä‘Ã¢y chÃºng ta Ä‘ang nÃ³i vá» viá»‡c thay Ä‘á»•i tÃ¡c giáº£ (Author) HÃ£y Ä‘á»•i Commiter á»Ÿ .gitconfig hoáº·c .git/config

Khi muá»‘n Ä‘á»•i tÃªn user hoáº·c email cá»§a HEAD

# HÃ£y sá»­a láº¡i user.name vÃ  user.email $ git commit --amend -m "ná»™i dung commit message" --author="user.name <user.email>"

TrÆ°á»ng há»£p muá»‘n sá»­a láº¡i commit tá»« lÃ¢u rá»“i

$ git rebase -i <commit> ==== # Sau lá»‡nh nÃ y sáº½ má»Ÿ ra editor nÃªn hÃ£y sá»­a láº¡i nhÆ° sau rá»“i lÆ°u láº¡i # (trÆ°á»›c khi sá»­a) cÃ¡c commit cÅ© tá»« trÃªn xuá»‘ng dÆ°á»›i pick aa11bbc commit message 1 pick b2c3c4d commit message 2 pick 4e56fgh commit message 3 ãƒ»ãƒ»ãƒ» # (Sau khi sá»­a) Äá»•i commit cáº§n sá»­a sang edit edit aa11bbc commit message 1 pick b2c3c4d commit message 2 pick 4e56fgh commit message 3 ãƒ»ãƒ»ãƒ» ==== # Sau Ä‘Ã³ thÃ¬ sá»­a tÆ°Æ¡ng tá»± $ git commit --amend -m "commit message" --author="user.name <user.email>" # Trá»Ÿ láº¡i nhÆ° cÅ© $ git rebase --continue

(NGUY HIá»‚M) Viáº¿t láº¡i toÃ n bá»™ lá»‹ch sá»­ commit

Khi muá»‘n sá»­a cÃ¡c commit cá»§a ngÆ°á»i dÃ¹ng (committer) nháº¥t Ä‘á»‹nh thÃ¬ cÃ³ thá»ƒ dÃ¹ng cÃ¡ch sau Ä‘á»ƒ sá»­a

Lá»‹ch sá»­ commit sáº½ bá»‹ thay Ä‘á»•i hoÃ n toÃ n

git filter-branch --commit-filter ' if [ "$GIT_COMMITTER_NAME" = "<Old Name>" ]; then GIT_COMMITTER_NAME="<New Name>"; GIT_AUTHOR_NAME="<New Name>"; GIT_COMMITTER_EMAIL="<New Email>"; GIT_AUTHOR_EMAIL="<New Email>"; git commit-tree "$@"; else git commit-tree "$@"; fi' HEAD

Sá»± cá»‘ ï¼“ï¼š Khi Ä‘Ã£ lá»¡ tay commit má»™t sá»‘ file thá»«a nhÆ°ng sau khi nghÄ© láº¡i thÃ¬ nÃªn ignore thÃ¬ hÆ¡n

TrÆ°á»ng há»£p commit xoÃ¡

Náº¿u cÃ³ nhá»¯ng pháº§n thá»«a thÃ¬ ta xoÃ¡ Ä‘i rá»“i thÃªm vÃ o ignore

# Äáº§u tiÃªn lÃ  xoÃ¡ cÃ¡c file Ä‘Ã£ commit khá»i repository $ git rm --cached <tÃªn file> # Sau Ä‘Ã³ lÃ  thÃªm vÃ o gitignore $ echo '<tÃªn file>' >> .gitignore

TrÆ°á»ng há»£p muá»‘n coi nhÆ° lÃ  chÆ°a tá»«ng cÃ³ file Ä‘Ã³

Khi mÃ  báº¡n muá»‘n: “Háº£, file nÃ o cÆ¡, lÃ  gÃ¬ cÃ³ file nÃ o nhÆ° tháº¿ ?”

# TrÆ°á»ng há»£p chá»‰ xoÃ¡ khá»i lá»‹ch sá»­ commit ï¼ˆÄ‘á»ƒ láº¡i á»Ÿ working treeï¼‰ $ git filter-branch -f --index-filter 'git rm --cached -rf --ignore-unmatch <tÃªn file>' HEAD # TrÆ°á»ng há»£p xoÃ¡ khá»i lá»‹ch sá»­ commit vÃ  cáº£ á»Ÿ working tree $ git filter-branch -f --index-filter 'git rm -rf --ignore-unmatch <tÃªn file>' HEAD

Sá»± cá»‘ 4ï¼š Khi mÃ  tÃªn branh báº¡n Ä‘áº·t quÃ¡ lÃ  “chuá»‘i”

Náº¿u khÃ´ng ai nhÃ¬n tháº¥y thÃ¬ ta “bÃ­ máº­t” sá»­a láº¡i tÃªn branch thÃ´i nÃ o !

$ git branch -m <tÃªn branch sau khi Ä‘á»•i>

Sá»± cá»‘ 5ï¼š Khi trong phÃºt nÃ´ng ná»•i báº¡n lá»¡ commit vÃ  giá» muá»‘n commit Ä‘Ã³ biáº¿n máº¥t

KhÃ´ng Ä‘á»ƒ cho ai biáº¿t ï¼ˆï¼ ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c váº«n chÆ°a pull vá»ï¼‰

Sá»­a láº¡i pháº§n lá»‹ch sá»­ commit ngay trÆ°á»›c Ä‘Ã³

# Tuá»³ vÃ o tá»«ng trÆ°á»ng há»£p mÃ  ta cÃ³ 3 cÃ¡ch sau Ä‘á»ƒ Ä‘Æ°a lá»‹ch sá»­ commit vá» nhÆ° cÅ© # 1. Chá»‰ Ä‘Æ°a HEAD vá» nhÆ° cÅ© $ git reset --soft HEAD~ # 2. ÄÆ°a HEAD vÃ  index vá» nhÆ° cÅ© $ git reset HEAD~ # 3. ÄÆ°a cáº£ index, working tree vá» 1 commit trÆ°á»›c Ä‘Ã³ $ git reset --hard HEAD~

TrÆ°á»ng há»£p Ä‘Ã£ bá»‹ ai Ä‘Ã³ phÃ¡t hiá»‡nï¼ˆï¼ ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c Ä‘Ã£ pull vá»ï¼‰

Náº¿u thay Ä‘á»•i lá»‹ch sá»­ commit sáº½ dáº«n Ä‘áº¿n tÃ¬nh tráº¡ng lá»™n xá»™n nÃªn ta cáº§m dÃ¹ng commit xoÃ¡ Ä‘á»ƒ giáº£i quyáº¿t

Sá»± cá»‘ 6ï¼š Khi muá»‘n tá»•ng há»£p nhá»¯ng commit vá»¥n váº·t trÆ°á»›c Ä‘Ã¢y thÃ nh má»™t commit

Sá»­ dá»¥ng rebase + squash (or fixup) Ä‘á»ƒ tá»•ng há»£p láº¡i cÃ¡c commit cÅ©

# Rebase vá» n commit trÆ°á»›c (cÃ³ bao gá»“m cáº£ HEAD) # VÃ­ dá»¥) git rebase -i HEAD~3 $ git rebase -i HEAD~<sá»‘ lÆ°á»£ng commit> ==== # Sau lá»‡nh nÃ y sáº½ má»Ÿ ra editor nÃªn hÃ£y sá»­a láº¡i nhÆ° sau rá»“i lÆ°u láº¡i # (trÆ°á»›c khi sá»­a) cÃ¡c commit cÅ© tá»« trÃªn xuá»‘ng dÆ°á»›i pick aa11bbc commit message 1 pick b2c3c4d commit message 2 pick 4e56fgh commit message 3 ãƒ»ãƒ»ãƒ» # (sau khi sá»­a) cÃ¡c commit trÆ°á»›c lÃ  squash sáº½ Ä‘Æ°á»£c tá»•ng há»£p vÃ o 1 commit á»Ÿ Ä‘áº±ng trÆ°á»›c pick aa11bbc commit message 1 squash b2c3c4d commit message 2 squash 4e56fgh commit message 3 ãƒ»ãƒ»ãƒ» ====

Thay vÃ¬ dÃ¹ng squash cÃ³ thá»ƒ dÃ¹ng fixup nhÆ°ng khi Ä‘Ã³ commit message cá»§a nhá»¯ng commit Ä‘Æ°á»£c fixup sáº½ bá»‹ máº¥t

Sá»± cá»‘ ï¼—ï¼š Khi báº¡n muá»‘n chia commit to thÃ nh nhá»¯ng commit nhá» hÆ¡n má»™t cÃ¡ch thÃ´ng minh

á» má»¥c 6, tuy tá»•ng há»£p láº¡i lÃ  tá»‘t nhÆ°ng khi tá»•ng há»£p quÃ¡ nhiá»u cÅ©ng sáº½ trá»Ÿ thÃ nh váº¥n Ä‘á» Ráº¥t tiá»‡n khi mÃ  nhá»¯ng commit chá»©c nÄƒng bá»‹ láº«n vÃ o nhá»¯ng commit sá»­a bug

# ÄÃ¢y lÃ  viá»‡c khÃ´ng lÃ m sau khi Ä‘Ã£ push code lÃªn remote # Äáº§u tiÃªn lÃ  Ä‘Æ°a HEAD vÃ  index vá» 1 commit trÆ°á»›c Ä‘Ã³ # NÃ³i cÃ¡ch khÃ¡c lÃ  ta coi nhÆ° lÃ  chÆ°a tá»«ng cÃ³ commit to Ä‘Ã¹ng kia vÃ  chá»‰ giá»¯ láº¡i tráº¡ng thÃ¡i cá»§a working tree $ git reset HEAD~ # DÃ¹ng lá»‡nh sau Ä‘Ã¢y Ä‘á»ƒ thÃªm (y) hoáº·c khÃ´ng thÃªm (n) cÃ¡c pháº§n nhá» (=hunk) vÃ o index # Náº¿u cÃ¡c pháº§n nhá» Ä‘Ã³ váº«n chÆ°a Ä‘á»§ nhá» thÃ¬ dÃ¹ng (s) Ä‘á»ƒ tiáº¿p tá»¥c chia nhá» hÆ¡n ï¼ˆChi tiáº¿t cá»§a git add -p thÃ¬ hÃ£y há»i anh Google nhÃ©ï¼‰ $ git add -p # Khi cÃ¡c pháº§n cáº§n thay Ä‘á»•i Ä‘Ã£ cÃ³ thÃ¬ ta commit $ git commit -m "commit message" # Sau Ä‘Ã³ ta láº·p Ä‘i láº·p láº¡i cÃ¡c bÆ°á»›c nhÆ° trÃªn cho pháº§n cÃ²n láº¡i

Sá»± cá»‘ ï¼˜ï¼š Khi lá»¡ tay commit nháº§m sang má»™t branch khÃ¡c

CÃ³ nhá»¯ng lÃºc ta sÆ¡ suáº¥t lá»¡ tay commit tháº³ng vÃ o master trong khi thá»±c ra lÃ  muá»‘n commit vÃ o má»™t branch khÃ¡c

# Äáº§u tiÃªn lÃ  táº¡o má»™t branch khÃ¡c chá»©a tráº¡ng thÃ¡i mÃ  ta Ä‘Ã£ commit $ git branch other-branch # ÄÆ°a HEAD, index cá»§a master vá» 1 commit trÆ°á»›c Ä‘Ã³ $ git reset --hard HEAD~ # Check out sang branch cÃ³ commit trÆ°á»›c Ä‘Ã³ $ git checkout other-branch

Sá»± cá»‘ ï¼™ï¼š Khi muá»‘n xoÃ¡ hoÃ n toÃ n cÃ¡c file khÃ´ng cáº§n thiáº¿t

CÃ³ nhá»¯ng lÃºc ta muá»‘n 1 phÃ¡t xoÃ¡ táº¥t táº§n táº­t nhá»¯ng file tá»± Ä‘á»™ng sinh ra hoáº·c nhá»¯ng file tá»± Ä‘á»™ng back up. Náº¿u khÃ´ng pháº£i lÃ  nhá»¯ng file cáº§n git quáº£n lÃ½ hoáº·c nhá»¯ng file sáº½ commit thÃ¬ xoÃ¡ Ä‘i thÃ´i. Æ  mÃ  cÃ¡i nÃ y cÅ©ng ko pháº£i lÃ  sá»± cá»‘ nhá»‰…

# Äáº§u tiÃªn lÃ  addï¼†commit táº¥t cáº£ nhá»¯ng thá»© cáº§n thiáº¿t láº¡i # Náº¿u khÃ´ng lÃ m nhÆ° tháº¿ nÃ y thÃ¬ nhá»¯ng file nÃ y cÅ©ng bá»‹ xoÃ¡ máº¥t Ä‘Ã³ $ git add <file cáº§n commit> $ git commit -m "commit message" # DÃ¹ng git stash Ä‘á»ƒ sÆ¡ tÃ¡n cáº£ nhá»¯ng file untracked $ git stash -u # drop cÃ¡c thá»© Ä‘Ã£ stash Ä‘á»ƒ xoÃ¡ Ä‘i $ git stash drop

Tiá»‡n Ä‘Ã¢y thÃ¬ trong trÆ°á»ng há»£p chá»‰ lÃ  nhá»¯ng file mÃ  git khÃ´ng quáº£n lÃ½ thÃ¬ chá»‰ nhÆ° sau lÃ  OK

# Kiá»ƒm tra láº¡i cÃ¡c file sáº½ xoÃ¡ cho cháº¯c $ git clean -n # Tiáº¿n hÃ nh xoÃ¡ bá» $ git clean -f

Sá»± cá»‘ 10ï¼š Khi táº¡m thá»i cáº§n táº¡m dá»«ng cÃ´ng viá»‡c hiá»‡n táº¡i vÃ  chuyá»ƒn sang má»™t branch khÃ¡c

Tuy mÃ¬nh khÃ´ng xáº¥u nhÆ°ng cÃ³ nhá»¯ng lÃºc cáº§n pháº£i táº¡m dá»«ng cÃ´ng viá»‡c Ä‘á»ƒ lÃ m viá»‡c khÃ¡c

# Táº¡m thá»i lÆ°u láº¡i cÃ¡c pháº§n cÃ´ng viá»‡c cÃ²n Ä‘ang lÃ m dá»Ÿ $ git stash -u # Chuyá»ƒn sang má»™t branch khÃ¡c vÃ  lÃ m viá»‡c $ git checkout -b other-branch ~lÃ m viá»‡c, lÃ m viá»‡c, lÃ m viá»‡c~ $ git add <cÃ¡c file cáº§n thiáº¿t> $ git commit -m "commit message" # Trá»Ÿ vá» branch cÅ© $ git checkout origin-branch # Láº¥y láº¡i cÃ¡c ná»™i dung cÃ´ng viá»‡c Ä‘ang lÃ m dá»Ÿ trÆ°á»›c Ä‘Ã³ $ git stash pop

Sá»± cá»‘ 11ï¼šKhi lá»¡ tay xoÃ¡ máº¥t má»™t commit cá»±c kÃ¬ cá»±c kÃ¬ quan trá»ng

ÄÃ¢y háº³n lÃ  sá»± cá»‘ khá»§ng khiáº¿p nháº¥t. CÃ³ thá»ƒ xáº£y ra khi lá»¡ tay git reset --hard Tuy nhiÃªn, commit nÃ o cÅ©ng cÃ³ thá»ƒ há»“i phá»¥c Ä‘Æ°á»£c

# Äáº§u tiÃªn lÃ  xem láº¡i toÃ n bá»™ lá»‹ch sá»­ commit $ git reflog # Tá»« Ä‘Ã³ chá»n commit muá»‘n phá»¥c há»“i vÃ  khÃ´i phá»¥c láº¡i # vÃ­ dá»¥ï¼‰git reset --hard HEAD@{2} $ git reset --hard <commit>

Sá»± cá»‘ 12ï¼š Khi lá»¡ tay xoÃ¡ máº¥t branch vÃ  muá»‘n láº¥y láº¡i

Náº¿u váº«n cÃ²n reflog thÃ¬ khÃ´ng cÃ³ sao. Váº«n cÃ³ thá»ƒ há»“i phá»¥c láº¡i Ä‘Æ°á»£c Náº¿u commit lÃªn má»™t branch khÃ´ng tÃªn, sau Ä‘Ã³ check out sang má»™t branch khÃ¡c bá»‹ xoÃ¡ máº¥t thÃ¬ cÅ©ng tÆ°Æ¡ng tá»±

TÆ°Æ¡ng tá»± giá»‘ng nhÆ° sá»± cá»‘ 13 dÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y

# Äáº§u tiÃªn lÃ  xem láº¡i toÃ n bá»™ lá»‹ch sá»­ commit $ git reflog # Tá»« cÃ¡c commit nÃ y, chá»n rá»“i táº¡o branch má»›i # vÃ­ dá»¥ï¼‰git branch new-branch HEAD@{2} $ git branch <tÃªn branch> <commit>

Sá»± cá»‘ 13: Khi muá»‘n thay Ä‘á»•i má»™t pháº§n ná»™i dung commit

Khi cÃ³ nhá»¯ng typo nhá» vÃ  muá»‘n chá»‰nh sá»­a thÃ¬ ko cáº§n thiáº¿t pháº£i táº¡o commit má»›i Ä‘á»ƒ sá»­a mÃ  hÃ£y tiáº¿n hÃ nh sá»­a láº¡i luÃ´n

# Chá»‰ Ä‘á»‹nh commit muá»‘n sá»­a láº¡i $ git rebase -i <commit> ==== # Sau lá»‡nh nÃ y sáº½ má»Ÿ ra editor nÃªn hÃ£y sá»­a láº¡i nhÆ° sau rá»“i lÆ°u láº¡i # (trÆ°á»›c khi sá»­a) cÃ¡c commit cÅ© tá»« trÃªn xuá»‘ng dÆ°á»›i pick aa11bbc commit message 1 pick b2c3c4d commit message 2 pick 4e56fgh commit message 3 ãƒ»ãƒ»ãƒ» # (Sau khi sá»­a) Äá»•i commit cáº§n sá»­a sang edit edit aa11bbc commit message 1 pick b2c3c4d commit message 2 pick 4e56fgh commit message 3 ãƒ»ãƒ»ãƒ» ==== # Commit cáº§n sá»­a sáº½ Ä‘Æ°á»£c khai triá»ƒn working tree nÃªn ta chá»‰ cáº§n sá»­a rá»“i sau Ä‘Ã³ add láº¡i $ git add <tÃªn file> # Sá»­a láº¡i commit $ git commit --amend # HoÃ n táº¥t rebase Ä‘á»ƒ trá»Ÿ láº¡i nhÆ° cÅ© $ git rebase --continue # Khi muá»‘n huá»· bá» rebase $ git rebase --abort

Sá»± cá»‘ 14: Khi cÃ³ conflict trong quÃ¡ trÃ¬nh rebase

Khi khÃ´ng merge mÃ  tiáº¿n hÃ nh rebase thÃ¬ náº¿u cÃ³ conflict, cháº¯c háº³n lÃ  hoáº£ng loáº¡n rá»“i

# Khi Ä‘ang á»Ÿ branch1 rá»“i rebase tá»« branch2 vÃ o $ git rebase branch2 ~~ PhÃ¡t sinh conflict ~~ # Sáº½ trá»Ÿ thÃ nh branch khÃ´ng tÃªn ná»n cáº§n pháº£i chÃº Ã½ $ git branch * (no branch, rebasing branch2) branch1 branch2 master # HÃ£y cá»‘ gáº¯ng giáº£i quyáº¿t cÃ¡c conflict # Sau khi hoÃ n thÃ nh, ta add rá»“i tiáº¿n hÃ nh rebase $ git add <tÃªn file> # Thay Ä‘á»•i commit $ git commit --amend $ git rebase --continue

Sá»± cá»‘ 15: Khi Ä‘Ã£ merge nhÆ°ng láº¡i muá»‘n trá»Ÿ láº¡i nhÆ° lÃºc trÆ°á»›c

Chá»‰ cho trÆ°á»ng há»£p mÃ  ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c váº«n chÆ°a pull code vá»

# tiáº¿n hÃ nh merge $ git checkout <tÃªn brach nguá»“n> $ git merge <tÃªn branch muá»‘n merge> # Sau khi merge, nhÆ°ng láº¡i muá»‘n trá»Ÿ láº¡i nhÆ° trÆ°á»›c thÃ¬ lÃ m nhÆ° sau # Náº¿u chá»‰ Ä‘á»‹nh lÃ  ORIG_HEAD thÃ¬ cÃ³ thá»ƒ trá»Ÿ láº¡i tráº¡ng thÃ¡i trÆ°á»›c khi merge $ git reset --hard ORIG_HEAD

á» trÃªn Remote

Sá»± cá»‘ 16: Khi pull tá»« remote vá» thÃ¬ cÃ³ quÃ¡ nhiá»u conflict nÃªn táº¡m thá»i muá»‘n trá»Ÿ láº¡i nhÆ° cÅ©

Sau khi pull code vá» cáº­p nháº­t nhÆ°ng tháº¥y conflict nhiá»u nhÆ° nÃºi thÃ¬ quáº£ lÃ  muá»‘n trá»Ÿ láº¡i nhÆ° cÅ© Gáº§n giá»‘ng nhÆ° sá»± cá»‘ 15

# Láº¥y tá»« code má»›i remote $ git pull origin master # PhÃ¡t sinh conflict # Suy nghÄ© láº¡i thÃ¬ trong pull(fetch + merge) muá»‘n bá» pháº§n merge Ä‘i $ git reset --hard ORIG_HEAD

Sá»± cá»‘ 17: Lá»¡ tay push force lÃªn master trÃªn remote

Viá»‡c push -f lÃªn origin/master lÃ  viá»‡c bá»‹ cáº¥m Tuy nhiÃªn thÃ¬ thá»‰nh thoáº£ng váº«n cÃ³ má»™t sá»‘ ngÆ°á»i lÃ m…

Ta sáº½ sá»­a láº¡i nhÆ° sau

TrÆ°á»ng há»£p chá»‰ cáº§n push vá» 1 commit trÆ°á»›c Ä‘Ã³

# CÃ¡i nÃ y ko Ä‘Æ°á»£c lÃ m Ä‘Ã¢u nhÃ©, push force $ git commit -m "commit message" $ git push -f origin master # Náº¿u lÃ  má»™t cÃ´ng ty nghiÃªm tÃºc thÃ¬ Ä‘áº¿n Ä‘Ã¢y cháº¯c cháº¯n sáº½ ná»•i giáº­n Ä‘áº¥y # Náº¿u muá»‘n Ä‘Æ°a vá» 1 commit tÆ°á»›c Ä‘Ã³ thÃ¬ lÃ m nhÆ° sau $ git push -f origin HEAD~:master

Náº¿u trÃªn local cÅ©ng muá»‘n nhÆ° váº­y thÃ¬ tiáº¿n hÃ nh reset cÅ©ng tá»‘t

$ git reset HEAD~ $ git push -f origin master

Náº¿u muá»‘n xoÃ¡ Ä‘i vÃ i commit trÆ°á»›c Ä‘Ã³

# CÃ¡i nÃ y ko Ä‘Æ°á»£c lÃ m Ä‘Ã¢u nhÃ©, push force $ git commit -m "commit message" $ git push -f origin master # Khi bá»‹ máº¯ng vÃ  muá»‘n trá»Ÿ vá» nhÆ° cÅ© thÃ¬ $ git rebase -i <commit muá»‘n rebase vá»> ==== # Sau lá»‡nh nÃ y sáº½ má»Ÿ ra editor nÃªn hÃ£y sá»­a láº¡i nhÆ° sau rá»“i lÆ°u láº¡i # (trÆ°á»›c khi sá»­a) cÃ¡c commit cÅ© tá»« trÃªn xuá»‘ng dÆ°á»›i pick aa11bbc commit message 1 pick b2c3c4d commit message 2 ãƒ»ãƒ»ãƒ» # (Sau khi sá»­a) XoÃ¡ cÃ¡c commit khÃ´ng cáº§n thiáº¿t Ä‘i pick b2c3c4d commit message 2 ãƒ»ãƒ»ãƒ» ==== # push force láº¡i má»™t láº§n ná»¯a $ git push -f origin master

Sá»± cá»‘ 18: Sau khi release phÃ¡t hiá»‡n tháº¥y cÃ³ bug vÃ  muá»‘n trá»Ÿ vá» nhÆ° cÅ©

Do phÃ¡t sinh thiá»‡t háº¡i nÃªn nhá»¯ng thá»© Ä‘Ã£ merge vÃ  maste cáº§n pháº£i chuyá»ƒn táº¡m thá»i vá» nhÆ° cÅ© Tuy nhiÃªn khÃ´ng thá»ƒ revert tá»«ng commit 1 náº¿u cÃ³ nhiá»u commit

# Kiá»ƒm tra commit log $ git log --oneline --graph ==== * 1x3y5z7 - Merge pull request #4 from develop |\ | * a2b45c7 - (develop) commit 3 * | dbc65f4 - commit 2 * | f0b0a91 - commit 1 # Chá»‰ Ä‘á»‹nh Ä‘iá»ƒm muá»‘n revert vá» (CÆ¡ báº£n 1 lÃ  OK) ==== # Náº¿u merge develop vÃ o master thÃ¬ chá»‰ Ä‘á»‹nh master sáº½ lÃ  ï¼‘ã€develop lÃ  ï¼’ rá»“i revert # VÃ­ dá»¥ï¼‰git revert -m 1 1x3y5z7 $ git revert -m 1 commit merge>

Náº¿u váº«n chÆ°a cÃ³ ai kÃ©o pháº§n code nÃ y vá» thÃ¬ cÃ³ thá»ƒ lÃ m Ä‘Æ°Æ¡c cáº£ nhá»¯ng viá»‡c sau ná»¯aï¼ˆCÃ¡i nÃ y nguy hiá»ƒmï¼‰

# Trá»Ÿ vá» tráº¡ng thÃ¡i trÆ°á»›c khi merge $ git reset ORIG_HEAD # PUSH FORCE $ git push -f origin master

Sá»± cá»‘ 19ï¼šKhi sau khi chuyá»ƒn láº¡i vÃ  Ä‘Ã£ commit thÃªm má»™t sá»‘ commit má»›i nhÆ°ng khÃ´ng thá»ƒ merge láº¡i Ä‘Æ°á»£c

á» sá»± cá»‘ 18, khi Ä‘Ã£ xoÃ¡ bá» merge, tiáº¿n hÃ nh chá»‰nh sá»­a nhÆ°ng merge láº¡i khÃ´ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c

commit revert khÃ´ng cÃ³ nghÄ©a lÃ  sáº½ ko cÃ²n commit merge ná»¯a mÃ  lÃ  lÃ m ngÆ°á»£c láº¡i nhá»¯ng viá»‡c mÃ  commit merge lÃ m

Tháº¿ nÃªn, khi merge láº¡i thÃ¬ cáº§n pháº£i revert láº¡i commit revert

# Tiáº¿p tá»¥c cá»§a sá»± cá»‘ 18 # ThÃªm commit vÃ o develop branch $ git checkout develop $ git commit -m "commit message" # Checkout sang master $ git checkout master # revert láº¡i commit revert $ git revert <commit revert> # merge develop $ git merge develop

Khi muá»‘n thá»­ nhá»¯ng Ä‘iá»u trÃªn á»Ÿ má»™t mÃ´i trÆ°á»ng an toÃ n thÃ¬

ÄÃºng lÃ  náº¿u chÆ°a quen mÃ  tá»± nhiÃªn láº¡i thá»±c hÃ nh luÃ´n thÃ¬ ráº¥t váº¥t váº£.

Nhá»¯ng ai Ä‘Ã£ cÃ³ sáº£n pháº§m thÃ¬ cÃ³ thá»ƒ clone vá» vÃ  dÃ¹ng cÃ¡i Ä‘Ã³ Ä‘á»ƒ test thá»­

Náº¿u tháº¿ thÃ¬ cho dÃ¹ cÃ³ bá»‹ tháº¥t báº¡i thÃ¬ cÅ©ng khÃ´ng gÃ¢y áº£nh hÆ°á»Ÿng gÃ¬ Ä‘áº¿n mÃ´i trÆ°á»ng lÃ m viá»‡c chÃ­nh.

Nhá»¯ng ai chÆ°a cÃ³ sáº£n pháº©m cÃ³ thá»ƒ lÃªn Github, tÃ¬m hiáº¿m 1 repo nÃ o Ä‘Ã³ ná»•i tiáº¿ng, clone vá» rá»“i thá»±c hÃ nh

Tuy nhiÃªn cáº§n chÃº Ã½ 1 Ä‘iá»u lÃ  nhá»¯ng cÃ¡i nÃ y chá»‰ Ä‘Æ°á»£c thá»­ á»Ÿ trÃªn mÃ´i trÆ°á»ng local thÃ´i nhÃ©

Náº¿u muá»‘n thá»­ cáº£ á»Ÿ trÃªn remote ná»¯a thÃ¬ cÃ³ thá»ƒ chuáº©n bá»‹ sáºµn mÃ´i trÆ°á»ng test trÃªn Github, clone vá» rá»“i thá»­

HÃ¬nh dung cÆ¡ báº£n nhÆ° sau

# git clone vá» $ git clone <URL cá»§a repository> # Thá»­ nghiá»‡m trÃªn local # Kiá»ƒm tra remote hiá»‡n táº¡i $ git remote -v # XoÃ¡ remote Ä‘Ã£ Ä‘Äƒng kÃ½ $ git remote rm origin # Táº¡o remote Ä‘Ã£ Ä‘Æ°á»£c chuáº©n bá»‹ sáºµn cho test á»Ÿ Github vÃ  thay Ä‘á»•i láº¡i remote $ git remote add origin <URL cá»§a repository má»›i> # Sau Ä‘Ã³ lÃ  thá»­ nghiá»‡m trÃªm remote
  • Github
  • Github
  • WebDesign

About Github Pages and Jekyll

Jekyll is a static site generator with built-in support for GitHub Pages.

Who can use this feature?

GitHub Pages is available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see “GitHubâ€™s plans.”

About Jekyll

Jekyll is a static site generator with built-in support for GitHub Pages and a simplified build process. Jekyll takes Markdown and HTML files and creates a complete static website based on your choice of layouts. Jekyll supports Markdown and Liquid, a templating language that loads dynamic content on your site. For more information, see Jekyll.

Jekyll is not officially supported for Windows. For more information, see “Jekyll on Windows” in the Jekyll documentation.

We recommend using Jekyll with GitHub Pages. If you prefer, you can use other static site generators or customize your own build process locally or on another server. For more information, see “About GitHub Pages.”

Configuring Jekyll in your GitHub Pages site

You can configure most Jekyll settings, such as your site’s theme and plugins, by editing your _config.yml file. For more information, see “Configuration” in the Jekyll documentation.

Some configuration settings cannot be changed for GitHub Pages sites.

lsi: false safe: true source: [your repo's top level directory] incremental: false highlighter: rouge gist: noscript: false kramdown: math_engine: mathjax syntax_highlighter: rouge

By default, Jekyll doesn’t build files or folders that:

  • are located in a folder called /node_modules or /vendor
  • start with _, ., or #
  • end with ~
  • are excluded by the exclude setting in your configuration file

If you want Jekyll to process any of these files, you can use the include setting in your configuration file.

Front matter

To set variables and metadata, such as a title and layout, for a page or post on your site, you can add YAML front matter to the top of any Markdown or HTML file. For more information, see “Front Matter” in the Jekyll documentation.

You can add site.github to a post or page to add any repository references metadata to your site. For more information, see “Using site.github” in the Jekyll Metadata documentation.

Themes

You can add a Jekyll theme to your GitHub Pages site to customize the look and feel of your site. For more information, see “Themes” in the Jekyll documentation.

You can add a supported theme to your site on GitHub. For more information, see “Supported themes” on the GitHub Pages site and “Adding a theme to your GitHub Pages site using Jekyll”.

To use any other open source Jekyll theme hosted on GitHub, you can add the theme manually. For more information, see themes hosted on GitHub and “Adding a theme to your GitHub Pages site using Jekyll”.

You can override any of your theme’s defaults by editing the theme’s files. For more information, see your theme’s documentation and “Overriding your theme’s defaults” in the Jekyll documentation.

Plugins

You can download or create Jekyll plugins to extend the functionality of Jekyll for your site. For example, the jemoji plugin lets you use GitHub-flavored emoji in any page on your site the same way you would on GitHub. For more information, see “Plugins” in the Jekyll documentation.

GitHub Pages uses plugins that are enabled by default and cannot be disabled:

  • jekyll-coffeescript
  • jekyll-default-layout
  • jekyll-gist
  • jekyll-github-metadata
  • jekyll-optional-front-matter
  • jekyll-paginate
  • jekyll-readme-index
  • jekyll-titles-from-headings
  • jekyll-relative-links

You can enable additional plugins by adding the plugin’s gem to the plugins setting in your _config.yml file. For more information, see “Configuration” in the Jekyll documentation.

For a list of supported plugins, see “Dependency versions” on the GitHub Pages site. For usage information for a specific plugin, see the plugin’s documentation.

GitHub Pages cannot build sites using unsupported plugins. If you want to use unsupported plugins, generate your site locally and then push your site’s static files to GitHub.

Syntax highlighting

To make your site easier to read, code snippets are highlighted on GitHub Pages sites the same way they’re highlighted on GitHub. For more information about syntax highlighting on GitHub, see “Creating and highlighting code blocks.”

By default, code blocks on your site will be highlighted by Jekyll. Jekyll uses the Rouge highlighter (which is compatible with Pygments). If you specify Pygments in your _config.yml file, Rouge will be used as the fallback instead. Jekyll cannot use any other syntax highlighter, and you’ll get a page build warning if you specify another syntax highlighter in your _config.yml file. For more information, see “About Jekyll build errors for GitHub Pages sites.”

If you want to use another highlighter, such as highlight.js, you must disable Jekyll’s syntax highlighting by updating your project’s _config.yml file.

kramdown: syntax_highlighter_opts: disable : true

If your theme doesn’t include CSS for syntax highlighting, you can generate GitHub’s syntax highlighting CSS and add it to your project’s style.css file.

rougify style github > style.css

Building your site locally

If you are publishing from a branch, changes to your site are published automatically when the changes are merged into your site’s publishing source. If you are publishing from a custom GitHub Actions workflow, changes are published whenever your workflow is triggered (typically by a push to the default branch). If you want to preview your changes first, you can make the changes locally instead of on GitHub. Then, test your site locally. For more information, see “Testing your GitHub Pages site locally with Jekyll.”

  • Github
  • Github
  • WebDesign

Báº¯t Ä‘áº§u vá»›i Github

1. VÃ¢Ìn Ä‘ÃªÌ€ Ä‘ÄƒÌ£t ra

  • NhiÃªÌ€u baÌ£n seÌƒ Ä‘ÄƒÌ£t cÃ¢u hoÌ‰i taÌ£i sao laÌ£i phaÌ‰i coÌ hÄƒÌ‰n mÃ´Ì£t chÆ°Æ¡ng triÌ€nh Ä‘ÃªÌ‰ quaÌ‰n liÌ vaÌ€ chia seÌ‰ source code trong khi code thiÌ€ Æ¡Ì‰ trong tay miÌ€nh, do miÌ€nh toaÌ€n quyÃªÌ€n quaÌ‰n liÌ, coÌ€n viÃªÌ£c chia seÌ‰ thiÌ€ quaÌ Ä‘Æ¡n giaÌ‰n: neÌn laÌ£i rÃ´Ì€i gÆ°Ì‰i qua usb/mail/chatwork/…? TrÆ°Æ¡Ìc Ä‘Ã¢y miÌ€nh cuÌƒng nghiÌƒ nhÆ° vÃ¢Ì£y vaÌ€ cuÌƒng Ä‘aÌƒ laÌ€m nhÆ° vÃ¢Ì£y (copy source code tÆ°Ì€ maÌy naÌ€y sang maÌy khaÌc qua usb ^^) —> miÌ€nh xin goÌ£i caÌch laÌ€m naÌ€y laÌ€ “caÌch nÃ´ng dÃ¢n”
  • Cho Ä‘ÃªÌn khi gÄƒÌ£p phaÌ‰i mÃ´Ì£t project lÆ¡Ìn maÌ€ mÃ´Ì£t miÌ€nh miÌ€nh khÃ´ng thÃªÌ‰ Ã´m hÃªÌt Ä‘Æ°Æ¡Ì£c vaÌ€ bÄƒÌt buÃ´Ì£c phaÌ‰i coÌ thÃªm 1 ngÆ°Æ¡Ì€i nÆ°Ìƒa code cuÌ€ng miÌ€nh, vÃ¢Ìn Ä‘ÃªÌ€ cuÌ‰a “caÌch nÃ´ng dÃ¢n” kia bÄƒÌt Ä‘Ã¢Ì€u xuÃ¢Ìt hiÃªÌ£n. ÄoÌ laÌ€ khi hai ngÆ°Æ¡Ì€i Ä‘aÌƒ hoaÌ€n thaÌ€nh phÃ¢Ì€n viÃªÌ£c cuÌ‰a miÌ€nh vaÌ€ muÃ´Ìn gheÌp code laÌ£i vÆ¡Ìi nhau.
  • NoÌ khÃ´ng giÃ´Ìng nhÆ° viÃªÌ£c xÃªÌp hiÌ€nh, chiÌ‰ cÃ¢Ì€n Ä‘ÄƒÌ£t cuÌ€ng vÆ¡Ìi nhau laÌ€ coÌ thÃªÌ‰ sÆ°Ì‰ duÌ£ng Ä‘Æ°Æ¡Ì£c. NhÃ¢Ìt laÌ€ khi trong quaÌ triÌ€nh code, seÌƒ coÌ nhÆ°Ìƒng file biÌ£ caÌ‰ 2 ngÆ°Æ¡Ì€i cuÌ€ng Ä‘uÌ£ng vaÌ€o gÃ¢y ra xung Ä‘á»™t (gá»i lÃ  conflict).

--> vÃ  Ä‘á»ƒ giáº£i quyáº¿t váº¥n Ä‘á» nÃ y, GIT Ä‘Ã£ Ä‘Æ°á»£c Linus Torvalds phÃ¡t triá»ƒn vÃ o nÄƒm 2005, ban Ä‘áº§u dÃ nh cho viá»‡c phÃ¡t triá»ƒn nhÃ¢n Linux. Äáº¿n nay, Git trá»Ÿ thÃ nh má»™t trong cÃ¡c pháº§n má»m quáº£n lÃ½ mÃ£ nguá»“n phá»• biáº¿n nháº¥t.

  • VÃ  trong bÃ i viáº¿t nÃ y, mÃ¬nh chá»‰ xin giá»›i thiá»‡u vá» cÃ¡ch hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng vÃ  cÃ¡c cÃ¢u lá»‡nh cÆ¡ báº£n cá»§a Git, cÃ²n viá»‡c cÃ i Ä‘áº·t vÃ  cáº¥u hÃ¬nh thÃ¬ cÃ³ ráº¥t nhiá»u bÃ i hÆ°á»›ng dáº«n trÃªn Ä‘Ã¢y rá»“i.

2. BÄƒÌt Ä‘Ã¢Ì€u vÆ¡Ìi git vaÌ€ cáº¥u trÃºc hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng cá»§a nÃ³:

HÃ¬nh áº£nh dÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y thá»ƒ hiá»‡n cÃ¡c hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng mÃ  ngÆ°á»i dÃ¹ng tÆ°Æ¡ng tÃ¡c vá»›i há»‡ thá»‘ng Git

  • á» Ä‘Ã¢y chÃºng ra sáº½ tÃ¬m hiá»ƒu vá» khÃ¡i niá»‡m Repository: hay Ä‘Æ°á»£c gá»i táº¯t lÃ  Repo Ä‘Æ¡n giáº£n lÃ  nÆ¡i chá»©a/cÆ¡ sá»Ÿ dá»¯ liá»‡u (database) táº¥t cáº£ nhá»¯ng thÃ´ng tin cáº§n thiáº¿t Ä‘á»ƒ duy trÃ¬ vÃ  quáº£n lÃ½ cÃ¡c sá»­a Ä‘á»•i vÃ  lá»‹ch sá»­ cá»§a dá»± Ã¡n (theo wikipedia.org).
  • VÃ  trong hÃ¬nh áº£nh trÃªn, ta tháº¥y cÃ³ 2 loáº¡i Repo lÃ  Repo bÃªn phÃ­a Server (Remote Repository) vÃ  Repo bÃªn phÃ­a Workstation (Local Repository):
    • Remote repository: LÃ  repository Ä‘á»ƒ chia sáº» giá»¯a nhiá»u ngÆ°á»i vÃ  bá»‘ trÃ­ trÃªn server chuyÃªn dá»¥ng.
    • Local repository: LÃ  repository bá»‘ trÃ­ trÃªn mÃ¡y cá»§a báº£n thÃ¢n mÃ¬nh, dÃ nh cho má»™t ngÆ°á»i dÃ¹ng sá»­ dá»¥ng.
  • Vá» cÃ¡ch hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng:
    • Láº­p trÃ¬nh viÃªn sáº½ lÃ m viá»‡c trá»±c tiáº¿p vá»›i “Local Repo”, vÃ  sau khi hoÃ n thÃ nh cÃ´ng viá»‡c cá»§a mÃ¬nh sáº½ lÆ°u commit trÃªn “Local Repo” rá»“i push request lÃªn “Remote Repo”.
    • Remote Repo sáº½ do Team-Lead quáº£n lÃ­, sáº½ kiá»ƒm tra trÆ°á»›c ghi quyáº¿t Ä‘á»‹nh cÃ³ gá»™p request Ä‘Ã³ vÃ o hay khÃ´ng. Náº¿u khÃ´ng sáº½ thÃ´ng bÃ¡o cho láº­p trÃ¬nh viÃªn sá»­a láº¡i rá»“i gá»­i láº¡i request. Äáº¿n khi cÃ³ request Ä‘Æ°á»£c gá»™p vÃ o Remote Repo, táº¥t cáº£ cÃ¡c mÃ¡y cÃ¡ nhÃ¢n (Local Repo) sáº½ pháº£i táº£i láº¡i báº£n má»›i nháº¥t trÃªn Remote Repo vá» vÃ  tiáº¿p tá»¥c lÃ m viá»‡c.

Hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng trÃªn Repository:

KhÃ¡i niá»‡m branch: dÃ¹ng Ä‘á»ƒ phÃ¢n nhÃ¡nh vÃ  ghi láº¡i luá»“ng cá»§a lá»‹ch sá»­. Branch Ä‘Ã£ phÃ¢n nhÃ¡nh sáº½ khÃ´ng áº£nh hÆ°á»Ÿng Ä‘áº¿n branch khÃ¡c nÃªn cÃ³ thá»ƒ tiáº¿n hÃ nh nhiá»u thay Ä‘á»•i Ä‘á»“ng thá»i trong cÃ¹ng 1 repository. HÆ¡n ná»¯a, branch Ä‘Ã£ phÃ¢n nhÃ¡nh cÃ³ thá»ƒ chá»‰nh sá»­a tá»•ng há»£p láº¡i thÃ nh 1 branch báº±ng viá»‡c há»£p láº¡i (merge) vá»›i branch khÃ¡c.

Git sáº½ quáº£n lÃ­ code giá»‘ng nhÆ° sÆ¡ Ä‘á»“ xÆ°Æ¡ng cÃ¡ vá»›i 1 nhÃ¡nh chÃ­nh lÃ  branch Master (nhÃ¡nh mÃ u xanh lÃ¡).

Khi báº¡n báº¯t Ä‘áº§u lÃ m viá»‡c, báº¡n sáº½ pháº£i táº¡o má»™t branch khÃ¡c vÃ  lÃ m viá»‡c trÃªn Ä‘Ã³. Äáº¿n khi pháº§n cÃ´ng viá»‡c Ä‘Ã³ hoÃ n thÃ nh, báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ gá»™p nÃ³ vÃ o branch master rá»“i tiáº¿p tá»¥c thá»±c hiá»‡n pháº§n viá»‡c khÃ¡c, vÃ  lá»‹ch sá»­ sá»­a Ä‘á»•i nÃ y sáº½ Ä‘Æ°á»£c lÆ°u láº¡i (náº¿u cáº§n cÃ³ thá»ƒ quay trá»Ÿ vá» giá»‘ng nhÆ° Ctrl Z váº­y).

CHÃš Ã:

  • Má»—i branch chá»‰ nÃªn thá»±c hiá»‡n má»™t cÃ´ng viá»‡c cá»¥ thá»ƒ
  • Branch má»›i báº¯t buá»™c pháº£i Ä‘Æ°á»£c táº¡o ra tá»« branch master (chá»© khÃ´ng pháº£i má»™t branch nhÃ¡nh khÃ¡c)

3. CÃ¡c cÃ¢u lá»‡nh cÆ¡ báº£n:

Quáº£n lÃ½ branch:

  • Kiá»ƒm tra danh sÃ¡ch branch: $ git branch , Ä‘á»ƒ thá»±c thi trÃªn remote repo, ta chá»‰ cáº§n cho thÃªm tÃ¹y chá»n -r hoáº·c --remote
  • XÃ³a branch:
    • khi Ä‘ang á»Ÿ branch khÃ¡c: $ git branch -d <branch_name>
    • khi Ä‘ang á»Ÿ branch cÃ¹ng tÃªn vá»›i remote branch muá»‘n xÃ³a: $ git push <remote_name> -d <branch_name>
  • Push branch tá»« Local lÃªn Remote vá»›i tÃªn khÃ¡c:
    • BÃ¬nh thÆ°á»ng, viá»‡c push má»™t branch á»Ÿ local lÃªn remote branch Ä‘Æ°á»£c thá»±c hiá»‡n báº±ng cÃ¡ch: $ git push <remote_name> <branch_name>
    • Tuy nhiÃªn viá»‡c push dÆ°á»›i má»™t tÃªn khÃ¡c sáº½ cÃ³ khÃ¡c biá»‡t, cá»¥ thá»ƒ: $ git push <remote_name> <local_branch_name>:<remote_branch_name>

Rebase vÃ  merge:

  • Rebase:

    $ git checkout <branch_name>

    $ git rebase <rebase_branch_name>

    • CÃ¡ch thá»±c hiá»‡n: Láº¥y code tá»« rebase_branch_name sau Ä‘Ã³ tá»« nhá»¯ng commit á»Ÿ Ä‘Ã³ táº¡o ra nhá»¯ng commit tÆ°Æ¡ng tá»± lÃªn branch_name. Thá»±c hiá»‡n rebase thÃ¬ cÃ¡c commit Ä‘Ã£ tá»“n táº¡i bá»‹ bá» Ä‘i vÃ  tÃ¡i táº¡o láº¡i cÃ¡c commit tÆ°Æ¡ng tá»± nhÆ°ng thá»±c ra lÃ  khÃ¡c biá»‡t. Äiá»u nÃ y lÃ m lá»‹ch sá»­ commit á»Ÿ local vÃ  remote khÃ¡c nhau.
    • Äáº·c Ä‘iá»ƒm: cÃ¡c commit cá»§a nhÃ¡nh Ä‘Æ°á»£c táº¡o má»›i sáº½ náº±m liá»n máº¡ch, vÃ  cÃ¡c commit cá»§a rebase-branch sáº½ lÃ  cÃ¡c commit má»›i nháº¥t.

  • Merge:

  • $ git checkout <branch_name>

    $ git merge <branch_2_name>

    • CÃ¡ch thá»±c hiá»‡n: git dÃ¹ng 2 báº£n commit cuá»‘i cÃ¹ng cá»§a tá»«ng nhÃ¡nh rá»“i tÃ­ch há»£p láº¡i vá»›i nhau táº¡o thÃ nh 1 commit má»›i theo kiá»ƒu hÃ¬nh thoi. Thá»±c hiá»‡n merge thÃ¬ cÃ¡c commit Ä‘Ã£ tá»“n táº¡i khÃ´ng bá»‹ thay Ä‘á»•i, chá»‰ táº¡o ra 1 commit má»›i tÃ­ch há»£p cá»§a 2 commit má»›i nháº¥t.
    • Äáº·c Ä‘iá»ƒm: cÃ¡c commit cá»§a 2 nhÃ¡nh Ä‘Æ°á»£c sáº¯p xáº¿p theo thá»i gian táº¡o commit.

Gá»™p commit:

TÃ¹y vÃ o tá»«ng mÃ´i trÆ°á»ng, cÃ´ng ty khÃ¡c nhau sáº½ cÃ³ nhá»¯ng yÃªu cáº§u khÃ¡c nhau vá» viá»‡c quáº£n lÃ½ commit. VÃ­ dá»¥ cÃ´ng ty yÃªu cáº§u má»—i request báº¡n gá»­i lÃªn chá»‰ cÃ³ duy nháº¥t 1 commit. Báº¡n vÃ o kiá»ƒm tra thÃ¬ láº¡i tháº¥y nhiá»u hÆ¡n, thÃ¬ cÃ´ng viá»‡c cá»§a báº¡n lÃ  gá»™p nhá»¯ng commit áº¥y láº¡i. VÃ  viá»‡c thá»±c hiá»‡n sáº½ ra sao?

$ git rebase -i <id_commit_end> || $ git rebase -i HEAD~<index>

  • <id_commit_end> lÃ  id cá»§a commit cuá»‘i trong nhÃ³m cáº§n gá»™p.
  • : sá»‘ commit cáº§n gá»™p. Sau Ä‘Ã³, cá»­a sá»• lÃ m viá»‡c hiá»‡n lÃªn, Ta cÃ³ cÃ¡c lá»±a chá»n pick|squash|fixup cÃ¡c commit trÆ°á»›c khi save.

Sau Ä‘Ã³ kiá»ƒm tra láº¡i báº±ng lá»‡nh: $ git log --oneline xem commit Ä‘Ã£ Ä‘Æ°á»£c gá»™p thÃ nh cÃ´ng hay chÆ°a.

Git stash:

Khi Ä‘ang lÃ m viá»‡c vá»›i má»™t branch rá»“i báº¡n chá»£t nháº­n ra mÃ¬nh cáº§n sá»­a á»Ÿ branch cÅ©, báº¡n sáº½ cáº§n checkout vÃ  pháº£i commit nhá»¯ng thay Ä‘á»•i. Tuy nhiÃªn, báº¡n chá»‰ cáº§n lÆ°u nÃ³ láº¡i mÃ  chÆ°a commit, vÃ  git stash sáº½ giÃºp báº¡n. NgoÃ i ra, cÃ³ 1 sá»‘ tuá»³ chá»n nhÆ°:

  • Xem láº¡i lá»‹ch sá»­ thay Ä‘á»•i: $ git stash list
  • Xem láº¡i lá»‹ch sá»­ thay Ä‘á»•i cÃ¹ng ná»™i dung cá»§a nÃ³: $ git stash list -p
  • Xem láº¡i lá»‹ch sá»­ thay Ä‘á»•i: $ git stash list
  • Xem láº¡i lá»‹ch sá»­ thay Ä‘á»•i cá»¥ thá»ƒ cá»§a láº§n 1: $ git stash show stash@{1}
  • Apply thay Ä‘á»•i cá»§a láº§n 1: $ git stash apply stash@{1}
  • XoÃ¡ thay Ä‘á»•i: $ git stash drop stash@{1}
  • XoÃ¡ toÃ n bá»™: $ git stash clear

Git reset:

Trong cuá»™c sá»‘ng, má»i hÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng thÃ¬ khÃ´ng thá»ƒ “hoÃ n tÃ¡c” Ä‘Æ°á»£c. NhÆ°ng khi lÃ m viá»‡c vá»›i mÃ¡y tÃ­nh, Ctrl-Z luÃ´n sáºµn sÃ ng Ä‘á»ƒ sá»­a chá»¯a sai láº§m cho báº¡n, vÃ  git cung cáº¥p cho báº¡n 3 phÆ°Æ¡ng phÃ¡p:

  • $ git reset <commit_id> khi ta muá»‘n di chuyá»ƒn HEAD Ä‘áº¿n commit reset vÃ  giá»¯ nguyÃªn táº¥t cáº£ thay Ä‘á»•i cá»§a file Ä‘áº¿n vá»‹ trá»‹ hiá»‡n táº¡i. Tuy nhiÃªn sáº½ loáº¡i bá» thay Ä‘á»•i khá»i stage.
  • $ git reset --hard <commit_id> khi nÃ³ váº«n di chuyá»ƒn HEAD Ä‘áº¿n commit reset nhÆ°ng sáº½ loáº¡i bá» táº¥t cáº£ thay Ä‘á»•i cá»§a file sau commit reset.
  • $ git reset --soft <commit_id> khi muá»‘n di chuyá»ƒn HEAD Ä‘áº¿n commit reset vÃ  cÃ³ Æ°u Ä‘iá»ƒm lÃ  sáº½ giá»¯ nguyÃªn táº¥t cáº£ thay Ä‘á»•i cá»§a file vÃ  cÃ¡c thay Ä‘á»•i á»Ÿ stage. –> vÃ¬ váº­y reset –soft Ä‘Æ°á»£c khuyáº¿n khÃ­ch sá»­ dá»¥ng hÆ¡n, tuy váº­y, báº¡n cÅ©ng nÃªn tÃ¹y chá»n phÃ¹ há»£p vá»›i hoÃ n cáº£nh vÃ  má»¥c Ä‘Ã­ch báº¡n mong muá»‘n.

Káº¿t luáº­n:

TrÃªn Ä‘Ã¢y chá»‰ lÃ  má»™t sá»‘ tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng thÆ°á»ng gáº·p khi lÃ m viá»‡c vá»›i Git mÃ  mÃ¬nh gáº·p pháº£i. NgoÃ i ra, muá»‘n trá»Ÿ thÃ nh Master Git thÃ¬ mÃ¬nh khuyÃªn cÃ¡c báº¡n nÃªn lao vÃ o lÃ m thá»±c táº¿, khi Ä‘Ã³ sáº½ phÃ¡t sinh ra nhiá»u tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng hÆ¡n, giÃºp báº¡n nÃ¢ng cao trÃ¬nh Ä‘á»™. NgoÃ i ra, cuá»‘n Pro Git á»Ÿ dÆ°á»›i sáº½ giÃºp Ä‘á»¡ cÃ¡c báº¡n pháº§n nÃ o.

Cáº£m Æ¡n cÃ¡c báº¡n vÃ  mong sá»›m gáº·p láº¡i cÃ¡c báº¡n trong cÃ¡c bÃ i viáº¿t tiáº¿p theo.

Tham kháº£o:

Ebook Pro Git ráº¥t chi tiáº¿t, bÃ i báº£n vá» git: https://git-scm.com/book/vi/v1/Báº¯t-Äáº§u-CÆ¡-Báº£n-vá»-Git

  • WebDesign

CÃ¡c trÃ¬nh tÃ­ch há»£p vá»›i Github

GitHub cÃ³ láº½ lÃ  má»™t trong nhá»¯ng ná»n táº£ng ná»•i tiáº¿ng nháº¥t trong cá»™ng Ä‘á»“ng dev, má»™t trong nhá»¯ng ná»n táº£ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c sá»­ dá»¥ng nhiá»u nháº¥t (náº±m ngay bÃªn cáº¡nh nhá»¯ng ná»n táº£ng khÃ¡c nhÆ° Stackoverflow). NÃ³ cho phÃ©p cÃ´ng khai cÃ¡c dá»± Ã¡n cá»§a báº¡n, quáº£n lÃ½ chÃºng vÃ  tháº­m chÃ­ tÃ¬m nhá»¯ng ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c Ä‘á»ƒ giÃºp Ä‘á»¡ vá» nhá»¯ng ná»— lá»±c nguá»“n má»Ÿ cá»§a há». Má»™t Ä‘iá»u chÃºng ta thÆ°á»ng khÃ´ng thá»±c sá»± chÃº Ã½ lÃ  kháº£ nÄƒng tÃ­ch há»£p vÃ o cÃ¡c há»‡ thá»‘ng khÃ¡c cá»§a nÃ³. ÄÃºng váº­y, GitHub khÃ´ng chá»‰ lÃ  nÆ¡i báº¡n Ä‘áº·t cÃ¡c dá»± Ã¡n cá»§a mÃ¬nh cho ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c xem, nÃ³ cÃ³ thá»ƒ Ä‘Ã³ng vai trÃ² lÃ  bÆ°á»›c Ä‘á»‡m cho ráº¥t nhiá»u ná»n táº£ng vÃ  há»‡ thá»‘ng khÃ¡c ngoÃ i Ä‘Ã³ vÃ  trong bÃ i viáº¿t nÃ y, tÃ´i sáº½ giá»›i thiá»‡u cho báº¡n. ÄÃ¢u lÃ  nhá»¯ng tÃ­ch há»£p hÃ ng Ä‘áº§u vá»›i GitHub báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ tÃ¬m tháº¥y (vÃ  cÃ³ thá»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng lÃ  tá»‘t).

1. IDE integration

Má»i nhÃ  phÃ¡t triá»ƒn Ä‘á»u cáº§n cho mÃ¬nh 1 IDE hay Text Editor, báº¡n sáº½ khÃ´ng thá»ƒ láº­p trÃ¬nh náº¿u nhÆ° thiáº¿u nÃ³. Váº­y hÃ£y báº¯t Ä‘áº§u vá»›i nhá»¯ng tÃ­ch há»£p trong IDE Sáº½ cÃ³ ráº¥t nhiá»u IDE, Text editor ngoÃ i kia, tÃ¹y thuá»™c vÃ o ngÃ´n ngá»¯ láº­p trÃ¬nh cá»§a báº¡n, nhÆ°ng má»™t sá»‘ IDE phá»• biáº¿n nháº¥t cÃ³ kháº£ nÄƒng bao gá»“m cÃ¡c plugin hoáº·c tiá»‡n Ã­ch má»Ÿ rá»™ng vÃ  do Ä‘Ã³ ngÆ°á»i dÃ¹ng Ä‘Ã£ quyáº¿t Ä‘á»‹nh thÃªm má»™t sá»‘ tÃ­nh nÄƒng tÃ­ch há»£p vá»›i GitHub

VSCode

Bá» qua ráº¥t nhiá»u tiá»‡n Ã­ch má»Ÿ rá»™ng chá»‰ tÆ°Æ¡ng thÃ­ch vá»›i Git, cÃ³ má»™t sá»‘ tiá»‡n Ã­ch cho phÃ©p báº¡n giao tiáº¿p vá»›i GitHub’s PR Api, cháº³ng háº¡n nhÆ°: GitHub Pull Requests

Tiá»‡n Ã­ch má»Ÿ rá»™ng nÃ y cho phÃ©p báº¡n xem xÃ©t vÃ  quáº£n lÃ½ PR cá»§a báº¡n ngay táº¡i Ä‘Ã³, tá»« bÃªn trong IDE. Náº¿u báº¡n Ä‘ang cháº¡y cÃ¡c dá»± Ã¡n cÃ³ khá»‘i lÆ°á»£ng PR lá»›n, Ä‘Ã¢y cÃ³ thá»ƒ lÃ  má»™t lá»±a chá»n thÃº vá»‹ Ä‘á»ƒ xem xÃ©t.

Sublime Text

ÄÃ¢y lÃ  má»™t trong nhá»¯ng Text editor ráº¥t phá»• biáº¿n trÆ°á»›c VSCode vÃ  tÃ´i nghÄ© nhiá»u ngÆ°á»i váº«n sá»­ dá»¥ng nÃ³.

VÃ  nhÆ° trÆ°á»›c Ä‘Ã¢y, cÃ³ ráº¥t nhiá»u plugin dÃ nh riÃªng cho git mÃ  báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng, nhÆ°ng thá»© tÃ´i muá»‘n giá»›i thiá»‡u lÃ : sublime-github

Äiá»u nÃ y cho phÃ©p báº¡n truy cáº­p vÃ o cÃ¡c tÃ­nh nÄƒng nhÆ° má»Ÿ má»™t gist direclty trÃªn cá»­a sá»• soáº¡n tháº£o hoáº·c táº¡o má»™t gist má»›i tá»« mÃ£ báº¡n Ä‘Ã£ chá»n. Ráº¥t há»¯u Ã­ch cho cÃ¡c hÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng nhanh chÃ³ng vÃ  dá»… dÃ ng mÃ  thÃ´ng qua plugin nÃ y cÃ³ thá»ƒ giÃºp báº¡n tiáº¿t kiá»‡m ráº¥t nhiá»u thá»i gian.

IntelliJ

IDE cuá»‘i cÃ¹ng tÃ´i muá»‘n trÃ¬nh bÃ y lÃ  IntelliJ má»™t IDE ráº¥t phá»• biáº¿n khÃ¡c tÆ°Æ¡ng thÃ­ch vá»›i nhiá»u ngÃ´n ngá»¯ láº­p trÃ¬nh khÃ¡c nhau.

IDE nÃ y cung cáº¥p nhiá»u tÃ­ch há»£p, táº¥t cáº£ nhá»¯ng gÃ¬ báº¡n cáº§n lÃ m lÃ  nháº­p thÃ´ng tin tÃ i khoáº£n GitHub cá»§a báº¡n vÃ  sau Ä‘Ã³ báº¯t Ä‘áº§u tÆ°Æ¡ng tÃ¡c vá»›i cÃ¡c tÃ­nh nÄƒng khÃ¡c nhau. Báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ táº¡o hoáº·c sao chÃ©p cÃ¡c dá»± Ã¡n, má»Ÿ phiÃªn báº£n cá»§a tá»‡p trá»±c tiáº¿p trong GitHub (tá»©c lÃ  náº¿u báº¡n Ä‘ang lÃ m viá»‡c trÃªn má»™t tá»‡p cá»¥ thá»ƒ vÃ  cáº§n kiá»ƒm tra phiÃªn báº£n GitHub ban Ä‘áº§u, báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ thá»±c hiá»‡n báº±ng vÃ i cÃº nháº¥p chuá»™t) cÅ©ng nhÆ° táº¡o gist directly trá»±c tiáº¿p tá»« IDE.

2. Issue tracker

Má»™t tÃ­nh nÄƒng thÃº vá»‹ khÃ¡c mÃ  GitHub cung cáº¥p, lÃ  kháº£ nÄƒng xá»­ lÃ½ cÃ¡c issue cá»§a dá»± Ã¡n báº±ng API cá»§a há», cÃ³ nghÄ©a lÃ  cÃ³ má»™t sá»‘ tÃ¹y chá»n ngoÃ i giÃºp báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng Ä‘á»ƒ má»Ÿ rá»™ng khÃ¡i niá»‡m vÃ  cÃ³ trÃ¬nh theo dÃµi issue trÃªn GitHub.

GitKraken Glo Boards

ÄÃ¢y cÃ³ láº½ lÃ  má»™t trong nhá»¯ng ná»n táº£ng tá»‘t nháº¥t hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng dá»±a trÃªn cÃ¡c issue GitHub vÃ  má»Ÿ rá»™ng cÃ¡c tÃ­nh nÄƒng cá»§a nÃ³.

Vá»›i Glo Boards, báº¡n khÃ´ng chá»‰ cÃ³ thá»ƒ hÃ¬nh dung cÃ¡c váº¥n Ä‘á» trÃªn báº£ng kanban, báº¡n cÃ²n cÃ³ thá»ƒ trá»±c tiáº¿p lÃªn lá»‹ch cho chÃºng báº±ng giao diá»‡n ngÆ°á»i dÃ¹ng ráº¥t trá»±c quan báº±ng cÃ¡ch kÃ©o vÃ  tháº£ cÃ¡c issue vÃ o lá»‹ch.

Náº¿u báº¡n Ä‘ang cá»‘ gáº¯ng xá»­ lÃ½ má»™t nhÃ³m (Ä‘áº·c biá»‡t lÃ  bÃ¢y giá» vá»›i nhu cáº§u cao vá» ká»¹ nÄƒng quáº£n lÃ½ nhÃ³m tá»« xa) thÃ¬ tÃ¹y chá»n nÃ y lÃ  má»™t cÃ¡ch Ä‘Æ¡n giáº£n vÃ  máº¡nh máº½ Ä‘á»ƒ sáº¯p xáº¿p cÃ´ng viá»‡c cáº§n thá»±c hiá»‡n.

3. Bots

Bit.dev (BitDevBot)

Bit.dev lÃ  má»™t trung tÃ¢m component Ä‘Ã¡m mÃ¢y phá»• biáº¿n. NÃ³ lÃ  nÆ¡i Ä‘á»ƒ xuáº¥t báº£n, tÃ i liá»‡u vÃ  sáº¯p xáº¿p cÃ¡c thÃ nh pháº§n JS (React, Angular, Vue, v.v.)

Báº±ng viá»‡c sá»­ dá»¥ng Bit, cÃ¡c thÃ nh pháº§n riÃªng láº» cÃ³ thá»ƒ Ä‘Æ°á»£c xuáº¥t báº£n tá»« báº¥t ká»³ kho lÆ°u trá»¯ / cÆ¡ sá»Ÿ mÃ£ nÃ o. Äiá»u Ä‘Ã³ cÃ³ nghÄ©a lÃ  nÃ³ khÃ´ng chá»‰ lÃ  má»™t cÃ´ng cá»¥ Ä‘á»ƒ xÃ¢y dá»±ng cÃ¡c há»‡ thá»‘ng thiáº¿t káº¿ mÃ  cÃ²n lÃ  má»™t cÃ´ng cá»¥ Ä‘á»ƒ há»£p tÃ¡c thÃ nh pháº§n.

Bit gáº§n Ä‘Ã¢y Ä‘Ã£ ra máº¯t vá»›i BitDevBot má»›i, bot Github tá»± Ä‘á»™ng hÃ³a cÃ¡c yÃªu cáº§u PR vÃ o kho lÆ°u trá»¯ vá»›i cÃ¡c thÃ nh pháº§n Ä‘Æ°á»£c import. VÃ¬ váº­y, báº¥t cá»© khi nÃ o má»™t thÃ nh pháº§n Ä‘Æ°á»£c cáº­p nháº­t, táº¥t cáº£ cÃ¡c kho lÆ°u trá»¯ cÃ³ liÃªn quan Ä‘á»u Ä‘Æ°á»£c nháº¯c há»£p nháº¥t cÃ¡c thay Ä‘á»•i má»›i. ÄÃ¢y khÃ´ng chá»‰ lÃ  má»™t cÃ¡ch Ä‘á»ƒ Ä‘áº£m báº£o ngÆ°á»i dÃ¹ng cá»§a cÃ¡c thÃ nh pháº§n khÃ´ng bao giá» bá» lá»¡ cÃ¡c báº£n cáº­p nháº­t quan trá»ng mÃ  cÃ²n lÃ  cÃ¡ch Ä‘á»ƒ nháº­n cÃ¡c báº£n cáº­p nháº­t thÃ nh pháº§n trong khi váº«n giá»¯ cÃ¡c thay Ä‘á»•i cá»¥c bá»™ Ä‘Æ°á»£c thá»±c hiá»‡n cho má»™t thÃ nh pháº§n trong má»™t dá»± Ã¡n cá»¥ thá»ƒ.

Slack

Má»™t ná»n táº£ng ráº¥t phá»• biáº¿n cho loáº¡i tÆ°Æ¡ng tÃ¡c nÃ y lÃ  Slack, sau táº¥t cáº£, nhiá»u cÃ´ng ty cÃ³ xu hÆ°á»›ng sá»­ dá»¥ng cÃ¡c slack rooms Ä‘á»ƒ nhÃ¢n viÃªn cá»§a há» trÃ² chuyá»‡n vá»›i nhau vÃ  chia sáº» thÃ´ng tin dá»±a trÃªn chá»§ Ä‘á» cá»§a tá»«ng phÃ²ng.

CÃ¡c nhÃ  phÃ¡t triá»ƒn tá»« GitHub Ä‘Ã£ phÃ¡t hÃ nh má»™t tÃ­ch há»£p vá»›i Slack, cho phÃ©p báº¡n xem chi tiáº¿t tá»« má»™t repo dá»±a trÃªn má»™t liÃªn káº¿t duy nháº¥t, Ä‘Äƒng kÃ½ vÃ o má»™t kho lÆ°u trá»¯ vá»›i má»™t lá»‡nh duy nháº¥t hoáº·c quáº£n lÃ½ cÃ¡c váº¥n Ä‘á» nhÆ° thá»ƒ báº¡n Ä‘ang cÃ³ má»™t cuá»™c trÃ² chuyá»‡n vá»›i Ä‘á»“ng nghiá»‡p.

4. Continuous Integration

Khi nÃ³i Ä‘áº¿n cÃ¡c giáº£i phÃ¡p tÃ­ch há»£p liÃªn tá»¥c, thá»‹ trÆ°á»ng cÃ³ má»™t sá»‘ tÃ¹y chá»n tuyá»‡t vá»i vÃ  háº§u háº¿t táº¥t cáº£ chÃºng Ä‘á»u cÃ³ má»™t sá»‘ loáº¡i tÃ­ch há»£p vá»›i GitHub.

Circle CI

CI / CD nÃ y tÃ­ch há»£p vá»›i GitHub cho phÃ©p báº¡n giÃ¡m sÃ¡t cÃ¡c pipelines cá»§a chÃºng trá»±c tiáº¿p tá»« bÃªn trong UI GitHub. Báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ tÃ¬m tháº¥y sá»± tÃ­ch há»£p trá»±c tiáº¿p trong GitHubâ€™s marketplace..

TravisCI

Má»™t tÃ¹y chá»n khÃ¡c cho má»™t ná»n táº£ng tÃ­ch há»£p vÃ  triá»ƒn khai liÃªn tá»¥c lÃ  TravisCI.

Náº¿u nhÃ³m cá»§a báº¡n Ä‘ang sá»­ dá»¥ng GitHub cho ná»n táº£ng kiá»ƒm soÃ¡t phiÃªn báº£n chÃ­nh cá»§a há», viá»‡c tÃ­ch há»£p nÃ³ vÃ o má»™t pipeline TravisCI vÃ  tá»± Ä‘á»™ng hÃ³a toÃ n bá»™ quÃ¡ trÃ¬nh tÃ­ch há»£p & triá»ƒn khai cÅ©ng dá»… dÃ ng nhÆ° nháº¥p vÃ o má»™t vÃ i liÃªn káº¿t.

5. Vulnerability

ÄÃ´i khi cÃ³ ai Ä‘Ã³ trong nhÃ³m cá»§a báº¡n kiá»ƒm tra mÃ£ cá»§a báº¡n Ä‘á»ƒ biáº¿t cÃ¡c lá»— há»•ng báº£o máº­t tá»«ng tá»“n táº¡i hoáº·c tháº­m chÃ­ cÃ¡c mÃ´ hÃ¬nh cÃ³ thá»ƒ bá»‹ khai thÃ¡c. May máº¯n cho báº¡n, cÃ³ má»™t sá»‘ tÃ¹y chá»n tÃ­ch há»£p vá»›i ná»n táº£ng kiá»ƒm soÃ¡t phiÃªn báº£n yÃªu thÃ­ch cá»§a chÃºng ta.

LGTM

TÆ°Æ¡ng thÃ­ch vá»›i sÃ¡u ngÃ´n ngá»¯ láº­p trÃ¬nh khÃ¡c nhau (bao gá»“m JavaScript vÃ  Python), cÃ´ng cá»¥ nÃ y sáº½ tá»± Ä‘á»™ng kiá»ƒm tra mÃ£ cá»§a báº¡n Ä‘á»ƒ tÃ¬m hÆ¡n 1600 lá»— há»•ng tiá»m nÄƒng khÃ¡c nhau trÆ°á»›c khi chÃºng Ä‘Æ°á»£c sáº£n xuáº¥t.

Prisma Cloud

Thay vÃ¬ táº­p trung vÃ o cÃ¡c nhÃ  phÃ¡t triá»ƒn, viá»‡c tÃ­ch há»£p nÃ y dÃ nh cho cÃ¡c nhÃ  phÃ¡t triá»ƒn, Ä‘á»ƒ giÃºp há» kiá»ƒm tra cÃ¡c lá»— há»•ng trÃªn cÃ¡c tá»‡p cáº¥u hÃ¬nh cá»§a há».

Cháº³ng háº¡n, nÃ³ sáº½ tÃ¬m kiáº¿m nhá»¯ng thá»© nhÆ° AWS CloudFormation Templates, HashiCorp Terraform templates, v.v. vÃ  quÃ©t chÃºng Ä‘á»ƒ kiá»ƒm tra cÃ¡c khiáº¿m khuyáº¿t tiá»m áº©n. ÄÃ¢y lÃ  Ä‘iá»u báº¯t buá»™c, Ä‘áº·c biá»‡t náº¿u báº¡n Ä‘ang cá»‘ gáº¯ng tá»± Ä‘á»™ng hÃ³a toÃ n bá»™ quÃ¡ trÃ¬nh triá»ƒn khai thÃ´ng qua GitHub vÃ  báº¥t ká»³ ná»n táº£ng triá»ƒn khai nÃ o tÃ­ch há»£p vá»›i nÃ³.

6. Code review

GitHub Ä‘Ã£ cÃ³ má»™t sá»‘ tÃ­nh nÄƒng review code Ä‘i kÃ¨m, Ä‘áº·c biá»‡t lÃ  má»™t pháº§n cá»§a giao diá»‡n PR.

Äiá»u Ä‘Ã³ Ä‘ang Ä‘Æ°á»£c nÃ³i, khÃ´ng cÃ³ gÃ¬ sai khi tÃ­ch há»£p má»™t sá»‘ á»©ng dá»¥ng cÃ³ thá»ƒ tá»± Ä‘á»™ng hÃ³a quy trÃ¬nh vÃ  Ã­t nháº¥t, kiá»ƒm tra mÃ£ cá»§a báº¡n Ä‘á»ƒ biáº¿t cÃ¡c váº¥n Ä‘á» rÃµ rÃ ng vÃ  reviewer ráº£nh hÆ¡n Ä‘á»ƒ xem xÃ©t mÃ£ cá»§a báº¡n vÃ  tÃ¬m cÃ¡c váº¥n Ä‘á» thá»±c sá»± cÃ³ liÃªn quan (cháº³ng háº¡n nhÆ° cÃ¡c váº¥n Ä‘á» vá»›i logic dá»± Ä‘á»‹nh cho chá»©c nÄƒng).

Má»™t á»©ng dá»¥ng nhÆ° váº­y lÃ  DeepSource, giÃºp phÃ¢n tÃ­ch mÃ£ cá»§a báº¡n vÃ  kiá»ƒm tra má»™t sá»‘ váº¥n Ä‘á» tiá»m áº©n, nhÆ°ng khÃ´ng giá»‘ng nhÆ° LGTM vÃ  Prisma Cloud, nhá»¯ng váº¥n Ä‘á» nÃ y cÃ³ liÃªn quan Ä‘áº¿n lá»—i tiá»m áº©n, váº¥n Ä‘á» vá» hiá»‡u suáº¥t vÃ  cÃ¡c váº¥n Ä‘á» khÃ¡c. Há» tháº­m chÃ­ cÃ²n Ä‘i xa Ä‘áº¿n má»©c tá»± Ä‘á»™ng táº¡o ra cÃ¡c váº¥n Ä‘á» cho cÃ¡c issue cá»§a báº¡n vÃ  Ä‘á» xuáº¥t giáº£i phÃ¡p cho má»™t sá»‘ váº¥n Ä‘á» Ä‘Ã³.

7. Dependency management

Quáº£n lÃ½ phá»¥ thuá»™c lÃ  má»™t pháº§n lá»›n trong cÃ¡c nhiá»‡m vá»¥ hÃ ng ngÃ y cá»§a chÃºng ta vá»›i tÆ° cÃ¡ch lÃ  nhÃ  phÃ¡t triá»ƒn, cho dÃ¹ chÃºng ta nháº­n ra hay khÃ´ng. NgÆ°á»i ta phÃ¡t minh ra chiáº¿c bÃ¡nh xe, vÃ  báº¡n sá»­ dá»¥ng nÃ³, nhÆ°ng báº¡n cÃ³ cháº¯c ráº±ng bÃ¡nh xe Ä‘Ã³ tá»‘t vÃ  tá»‘t Æ°u nháº¥t?

KhÃ´ng ai cÃ³ thá»ƒ nÃ³i ráº±ng chÃºng ta cÃ³ thá»ƒ tin tÆ°á»Ÿng chá»§ sá»Ÿ há»¯u cá»§a nhá»¯ng Dependency? Ai nÃ³i ráº±ng mÃ£ lÃ  hoÃ n háº£o vÃ  khÃ´ng cÃ³ lá»—i hoáº·c váº¥n Ä‘á» hiá»‡u suáº¥t? Máº·c dÃ¹ khÃ´ng pháº£i lÃ  ngÃ´n ngá»¯ duy nháº¥t cÃ³, nhÆ°ng á»Ÿ Ä‘Ã¢y tÃ´i sáº½ nÃ³i vá» Node.js vÃ  Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t sá»± tÃ­ch há»£p mÃ  báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ quan tÃ¢m: DepChecker-Bot

NÃ³ sáº½ phÃ¢n tÃ­ch sá»± phá»¥ thuá»™c npm cá»§a báº¡n vÃ  Ä‘Æ°a ra cáº£nh bÃ¡o vá» nhá»¯ng Ä‘iá»u nguy hiá»ƒm tiá»m tÃ ng.

8. Heroku

Sá»± tÃ­ch há»£p cuá»‘i cÃ¹ng vá»›i GitHub mÃ  tÃ´i muá»‘n Ä‘á» cáº­p, Ä‘Ã³ lÃ  Heroku, ná»n táº£ng nÃ y cho phÃ©p báº¡n triá»ƒn khai vÃ  cháº¡y á»©ng dá»¥ng cá»§a mÃ¬nh mÃ  khÃ´ng pháº£i lo láº¯ng vá» báº¥t ká»³ loáº¡i cÆ¡ sá»Ÿ háº¡ táº§ng hoáº·c táº­p lá»‡nh triá»ƒn khai tÃ¹y chá»‰nh nÃ o.

Heroku sáº½ lo táº¥t cáº£ má»i thá»© cho báº¡n vÃ  vá»›i sá»± tÃ­ch há»£p nÃ y, báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ tá»± Ä‘á»™ng hÃ³a cÃ¡c nhÃ¡nh há»£p nháº¥t thÃ nh cÃ´ng Ä‘á»ƒ triá»ƒn khai hoáº·c tháº­m chÃ­ cÃ³ cÃ¡c á»©ng dá»¥ng Ä‘Ã¡nh giÃ¡, Ä‘Æ°á»£c biÃªn dá»‹ch tá»« má»—i PR nháº­n Ä‘Æ°á»£c Ä‘á»ƒ báº¡n kiá»ƒm tra thá»§ cÃ´ng trong trÆ°á»ng há»£p Ä‘Ã³ lÃ  má»™t pháº§n cá»§a quy trÃ¬nh triá»ƒn khai cá»§a báº¡n.

Nguá»“n: https://blog.bitsrc.io/

Practical Guide

A Practical Guide To GitHub Actions

Excerpt

The software development lifecycle, such as writing, testing, and pushing code to the GitHub repository, takes a lot of effort and is quite time-consuming. To save time and avoid manual effort, we can automate the entire software development lifecycl…

VÃ²ng Ä‘á»i phÃ¡t triá»ƒn pháº§n má»m nhÆ° viáº¿t, kiá»ƒm tra vÃ  Ä‘áº©y mÃ£ lÃªn kho GitHub tá»‘n ráº¥t nhiá»u cÃ´ng sá»©c vÃ  khÃ¡ thá»i gian.

Äá»ƒ tiáº¿t kiá»‡m thá»i gian vÃ  trÃ¡nh ná»— lá»±c thá»§ cÃ´ng, chÃºng tÃ´i cÃ³ thá»ƒ tá»± Ä‘á»™ng hÃ³a toÃ n bá»™ vÃ²ng Ä‘á»i phÃ¡t triá»ƒn pháº§n má»m vá»›i sá»± trá»£ giÃºp cá»§a ná»n táº£ng GitHub Actions ráº¥t máº¡nh máº½ .

Trong bÃ i viáº¿t nÃ y, chÃºng tÃ´i sáº½ Ä‘á» cáº­p Ä‘áº¿n GitHub Actions lÃ  gÃ¬, nÃ³ giáº£i quyáº¿t váº¥n Ä‘á» gÃ¬, cÃ¡ch báº¡n xÃ¢y dá»±ng hÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng vÃ  má»™t vÃ­ dá»¥ thá»±c táº¿.

HÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng GitHub lÃ  gÃ¬?

GitHub Actions lÃ  má»™t ná»n táº£ng máº¡nh máº½ Ä‘á»ƒ tá»± Ä‘á»™ng hÃ³a quy trÃ¬nh lÃ m viá»‡c cá»§a báº¡n, bao gá»“m xÃ¢y dá»±ng, thá»­ nghiá»‡m vÃ  triá»ƒn khai mÃ£.

NÃ³ cho phÃ©p báº¡n xÃ¡c Ä‘á»‹nh quy trÃ¬nh cÃ´ng viá»‡c tÃ¹y chá»‰nh Ä‘Æ°á»£c kÃ­ch hoáº¡t bá»Ÿi cÃ¡c sá»± kiá»‡n khÃ¡c nhau, cháº³ng háº¡n nhÆ° khi báº¡n Ä‘áº©y mÃ£ vÃ o kho lÆ°u trá»¯ hoáº·c khi ai Ä‘Ã³ má»Ÿ yÃªu cáº§u kÃ©o.

Báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ tá»± Ä‘á»™ng hÃ³a toÃ n bá»™ vÃ²ng Ä‘á»i phÃ¡t triá»ƒn pháº§n má»m cá»§a mÃ¬nh báº±ng GitHub Actions, tá»« viáº¿t vÃ  kiá»ƒm tra mÃ£ Ä‘áº¿n triá»ƒn khai vÃ o sáº£n xuáº¥t.

Báº¡n cÅ©ng cÃ³ thá»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng cÃ¡c hÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c xÃ¡c Ä‘á»‹nh trÆ°á»›c do cá»™ng Ä‘á»“ng GitHub cung cáº¥p hoáº·c táº¡o cÃ¡c hÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng Ä‘á»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng trong quy trÃ¬nh lÃ m viá»‡c cá»§a mÃ¬nh.

váº¥n Ä‘á» gÃ¬ nÃ³ giáº£i quyáº¿t?

GitHub Actions giáº£i quyáº¿t váº¥n Ä‘á» vá» cÃ¡c tÃ¡c vá»¥ thá»§ cÃ´ng, tá»‘n thá»i gian trong quÃ¡ trÃ¬nh phÃ¡t triá»ƒn pháº§n má»m báº±ng cÃ¡ch cung cáº¥p cÃ¡ch tá»± Ä‘á»™ng hÃ³a cÃ¡c tÃ¡c vá»¥ nÃ y.

Báº±ng cÃ¡ch sá»­ dá»¥ng HÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng, báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ táº¡o quy trÃ¬nh cÃ´ng viá»‡c tÃ¹y chá»‰nh Ä‘Æ°á»£c kÃ­ch hoáº¡t bá»Ÿi cÃ¡c sá»± kiá»‡n cá»¥ thá»ƒ, cháº³ng háº¡n nhÆ° khi mÃ£ Ä‘Æ°á»£c Ä‘áº©y Ä‘áº¿n kho lÆ°u trá»¯ hoáº·c ai Ä‘Ã³ má»Ÿ yÃªu cáº§u kÃ©o.

Äiá»u nÃ y cho phÃ©p báº¡n tá»± Ä‘á»™ng hÃ³a toÃ n bá»™ vÃ²ng Ä‘á»i phÃ¡t triá»ƒn pháº§n má»m cá»§a mÃ¬nh, tá»« viáº¿t vÃ  kiá»ƒm tra mÃ£ Ä‘áº¿n triá»ƒn khai vÃ o sáº£n xuáº¥t.

Äiá»u nÃ y cÃ³ thá»ƒ tiáº¿t kiá»‡m thá»i gian vÃ  giáº£m kháº£ nÄƒng xáº£y ra lá»—i, cho phÃ©p báº¡n táº­p trung vÃ o cÃ¡c nhiá»‡m vá»¥ quan trá»ng hÆ¡n.

CÃ¡c thÃ nh pháº§n cá»§a hÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng GitHub

GitHub Actions cÃ³ má»™t sá»‘ thÃ nh pháº§n quan trá»ng phá»‘i há»£p vá»›i nhau Ä‘á»ƒ cho phÃ©p tá»± Ä‘á»™ng hÃ³a quy trÃ¬nh lÃ m viá»‡c cá»§a báº¡n.

  • Sá»± kiá»‡n : CÃ¡c sá»± kiá»‡n xáº£y ra trong kho lÆ°u trá»¯ cá»§a báº¡n, cháº³ng háº¡n nhÆ° khi báº¡n Ä‘áº©y mÃ£ Ä‘áº¿n má»™t nhÃ¡nh hoáº·c khi ai Ä‘Ã³ má»Ÿ yÃªu cáº§u kÃ©o. Khi má»™t sá»± kiá»‡n xáº£y ra, nÃ³ cÃ³ thá»ƒ kÃ­ch hoáº¡t má»™t quy trÃ¬nh cÃ´ng viá»‡c Ä‘á»ƒ cháº¡y.

  • Quy trÃ¬nh cÃ´ng viá»‡c : Quy trÃ¬nh cÃ´ng viá»‡c lÃ  cÃ¡c quy trÃ¬nh tá»± Ä‘á»™ng tÃ¹y chá»‰nh mÃ  báº¡n xÃ¡c Ä‘á»‹nh trong kho lÆ°u trá»¯ cá»§a mÃ¬nh. Má»™t quy trÃ¬nh cÃ´ng viá»‡c bao gá»“m má»™t hoáº·c nhiá»u cÃ´ng viá»‡c vÃ  cÃ³ thá»ƒ Ä‘Æ°á»£c kÃ­ch hoáº¡t bá»Ÿi má»™t sá»‘ sá»± kiá»‡n nháº¥t Ä‘á»‹nh.

  • CÃ´ng viá»‡c : CÃ´ng viá»‡c lÃ  nhá»¯ng nhiá»‡m vá»¥ táº¡o nÃªn má»™t quy trÃ¬nh cÃ´ng viá»‡c. Má»™t cÃ´ng viá»‡c cÃ³ thá»ƒ thá»±c hiá»‡n má»™t loáº¡t cÃ¡c bÆ°á»›c, cháº³ng háº¡n nhÆ° xÃ¢y dá»±ng vÃ  thá»­ nghiá»‡m mÃ£ hoáº·c triá»ƒn khai nÃ³ vÃ o sáº£n xuáº¥t.

  • NgÆ°á»i cháº¡y : NgÆ°á»i cháº¡y lÃ  cÃ¡c mÃ¡y hoáº·c mÃ´i trÆ°á»ng áº£o cháº¡y cÃ¡c cÃ´ng viá»‡c trong quy trÃ¬nh lÃ m viá»‡c. Báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng trÃ¬nh cháº¡y do GitHub cung cáº¥p hoáº·c báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng trÃ¬nh cháº¡y tá»± lÆ°u trá»¯ cá»§a mÃ¬nh.

  • HÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng : HÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng lÃ  nhá»¯ng Ä‘oáº¡n mÃ£ Ä‘Æ°á»£c xÃ¡c Ä‘á»‹nh trÆ°á»›c mÃ  báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng trong quy trÃ¬nh lÃ m viá»‡c cá»§a mÃ¬nh. Báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng cÃ¡c hÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng do cá»™ng Ä‘á»“ng GitHub cung cáº¥p hoáº·c táº¡o cÃ¡c hÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng Ä‘á»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng trong quy trÃ¬nh lÃ m viá»‡c cá»§a mÃ¬nh.

PhÃ¡t láº¡i phiÃªn mÃ£ nguá»“n má»Ÿ

OpenReplay lÃ  bá»™ phÃ¡t láº¡i phiÃªn, mÃ£ nguá»“n má»Ÿ cho phÃ©p báº¡n xem ngÆ°á»i dÃ¹ng lÃ m gÃ¬ trÃªn á»©ng dá»¥ng web cá»§a mÃ¬nh, giÃºp báº¡n kháº¯c phá»¥c sá»± cá»‘ nhanh hÆ¡n. OpenReplay tá»± lÆ°u trá»¯ Ä‘á»ƒ kiá»ƒm soÃ¡t hoÃ n toÃ n dá»¯ liá»‡u cá»§a báº¡n.

Báº¯t Ä‘áº§u táº­n hÆ°á»Ÿng tráº£i nghiá»‡m sá»­a lá»—i cá»§a báº¡n - báº¯t Ä‘áº§u sá»­ dá»¥ng OpenReplay miá»…n phÃ­ .

VÃ­ dá»¥ thá»±c táº¿ vá» HÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng GitHub

Má»™t vÃ­ dá»¥ thá»±c táº¿ vá» viá»‡c sá»­ dá»¥ng GitHub Actions lÃ  tá»± Ä‘á»™ng hÃ³a viá»‡c xÃ¢y dá»±ng, thá»­ nghiá»‡m vÃ  triá»ƒn khai mÃ£ cá»§a báº¡n.

VÃ­ dá»¥: báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ táº¡o quy trÃ¬nh lÃ m viá»‡c Ä‘Æ°á»£c kÃ­ch hoáº¡t khi mÃ£ Ä‘Æ°á»£c Ä‘áº©y tá»›i nhÃ¡nh cá»§a kho lÆ°u trá»¯ main.

Quy trÃ¬nh lÃ m viá»‡c cÃ³ thá»ƒ thá»±c hiá»‡n má»™t loáº¡t cÃ´ng viá»‡c, cháº³ng háº¡n nhÆ° xÃ¢y dá»±ng mÃ£, cháº¡y thá»­ nghiá»‡m vÃ  triá»ƒn khai mÃ£ vÃ o sáº£n xuáº¥t.

DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  vÃ­ dá»¥ vá» tá»‡p quy trÃ¬nh lÃ m viá»‡c cho ká»‹ch báº£n nÃ y cÃ³ thá»ƒ trÃ´ng nhÆ° tháº¿ nÃ o:

<span>name:</span> <span>Build,</span> <span>Test,</span> <span>and</span> <span>Deploy</span><span></span>
<span></span>
<span>on:</span>
  <span>push:</span>
    <span>branches:</span>
      <span>-</span> <span>main</span><span></span>
<span></span>
<span>jobs:</span>
  <span>build:</span>
    <span>runs-on:</span> <span>ubuntu-latest</span>
    <span>steps:</span>
      <span>-</span> <span>uses:</span> <span>actions/checkout@v2</span>
      <span>-</span> <span>uses:</span> <span>actions/setup-node@v1</span>
        <span>with:</span>
          <span>node-version:</span> <span>16</span>
      <span>-</span> <span>run:</span> <span>npm</span> <span>install</span>
      <span>-</span> <span>run:</span> <span>npm</span> <span>run</span> <span>build</span><span></span>
<span></span>
  <span>test:</span>
    <span>runs-on:</span> <span>ubuntu-latest</span>
    <span>steps:</span>
      <span>-</span> <span>uses:</span> <span>actions/checkout@v2</span>
      <span>-</span> <span>uses:</span> <span>actions/setup-node@v1</span>
        <span>with:</span>
          <span>node-version:</span> <span>16</span>
      <span>-</span> <span>run:</span> <span>npm</span> <span>install</span>
      <span>-</span> <span>run:</span> <span>npm</span> <span>test</span><span></span>
<span></span>
  <span>deploy:</span>
    <span>runs-on:</span> <span>ubuntu-latest</span>
    <span>steps:</span>
      <span>-</span> <span>uses:</span> <span>actions/checkout@v2</span>
      <span>-</span> <span>uses:</span> <span>actions/setup-node@v1</span>
        <span>with:</span>
          <span>node-version:</span> <span>16</span>
      <span>-</span> <span>run:</span> <span>npm</span> <span>install</span>
      <span>-</span> <span>run:</span> <span>npm</span> <span>run</span> <span>deploy</span>

MÃ£ nÃ y xÃ¡c Ä‘á»‹nh quy trÃ¬nh cÃ´ng viá»‡c Ä‘Æ°á»£c GitHub Actions tá»± Ä‘á»™ng cháº¡y trÃªn má»™t sá»‘ sá»± kiá»‡n nháº¥t Ä‘á»‹nh. Quy trÃ¬nh lÃ m viá»‡c cÃ³ ba cÃ´ng viá»‡c: build, test, vÃ  deploy. Nhá»¯ng cÃ´ng viá»‡c nÃ y Ä‘Æ°á»£c thá»±c hiá»‡n theo thá»© tá»± chÃºng xuáº¥t hiá»‡n trong mÃ£.

Khá»‘i onchá»‰ Ä‘á»‹nh thá»i Ä‘iá»ƒm quy trÃ¬nh lÃ m viá»‡c sáº½ Ä‘Æ°á»£c kÃ­ch hoáº¡t. Trong trÆ°á»ng há»£p nÃ y, nÃ³ Ä‘Æ°á»£c kÃ­ch hoáº¡t khi mÃ£ Ä‘Æ°á»£c Ä‘áº©y tá»›i nhÃ¡nh main.

actions/checkout@v2lÃ  má»™t HÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng GitHub cho phÃ©p báº¡n kiá»ƒm tra kho lÆ°u trá»¯ hoáº·c má»™t nhÃ¡nh, cam káº¿t hoáº·c gáº¯n tháº» cá»¥ thá»ƒ trong kho lÆ°u trá»¯. NÃ³ thÆ°á»ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c sá»­ dá»¥ng trong quy trÃ¬nh lÃ m viá»‡c Ä‘á»ƒ sao chÃ©p kho lÆ°u trá»¯ vÃ  kiá»ƒm tra mÃ£ á»Ÿ má»™t báº£n sá»­a Ä‘á»•i cá»¥ thá»ƒ.

actions/setup-node@v1lÃ  má»™t HÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng GitHub thiáº¿t láº­p mÃ´i trÆ°á»ng Node.js trÃªn trÃ¬nh cháº¡y. NÃ³ thÆ°á»ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c sá»­ dá»¥ng trong quy trÃ¬nh lÃ m viá»‡c Ä‘á»ƒ cÃ i Ä‘áº·t vÃ  Ä‘á»‹nh cáº¥u hÃ¬nh má»™t phiÃªn báº£n cá»¥ thá»ƒ cá»§a Node.js cÅ©ng nhÆ° má»i gÃ³i hoáº·c phá»¥ thuá»™c báº¯t buá»™c.

The v2vÃ  v1in actions/checkout@v2vÃ  actions/setup-node@v1, tÆ°Æ¡ng á»©ng, Ä‘á» cáº­p Ä‘áº¿n phiÃªn báº£n cá»§a hÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng. HÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng cÃ³ thá»ƒ cÃ³ nhiá»u phiÃªn báº£n vÃ  má»—i phiÃªn báº£n cÃ³ thá»ƒ cÃ³ chá»©c nÄƒng hoáº·c hÃ nh vi khÃ¡c nhau.

Má»—i cÃ´ng viá»‡c bao gá»“m cÃ¡c bÆ°á»›c Ä‘Æ°á»£c thá»±c hiá»‡n theo thá»© tá»± chÃºng xuáº¥t hiá»‡n trong mÃ£. CÃ´ng buildviá»‡c Ä‘áº§u tiÃªn sá»­ dá»¥ng hÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng actions/checkout@v2 Ä‘á»ƒ kiá»ƒm tra mÃ£ tá»« kho lÆ°u trá»¯. Sau Ä‘Ã³, nÃ³ sá»­ dá»¥ng hÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng actions/setup-node@v1 Ä‘á»ƒ thiáº¿t láº­p mÃ´i trÆ°á»ng Node.js Ä‘Ã£ cÃ i Ä‘áº·t phiÃªn báº£n 16.

Cuá»‘i cÃ¹ng, nÃ³ cháº¡y lá»‡nh npm installvÃ  npm run buildÄ‘á»ƒ cÃ i Ä‘áº·t cÃ¡c pháº§n phá»¥ thuá»™c cáº§n thiáº¿t vÃ  xÃ¢y dá»±ng mÃ£.

CÃ´ng testviá»‡c tÆ°Æ¡ng tá»± nhÆ° buildcÃ´ng viá»‡c, nhÆ°ng thay vÃ¬ cháº¡y npm run buildlá»‡nh, nÃ³ cháº¡y npm testlá»‡nh Ä‘á»ƒ thá»±c hiá»‡n kiá»ƒm tra mÃ£.

CÃ´ng deployviá»‡c cÅ©ng tÆ°Æ¡ng tá»± nhÆ° buildcÃ´ng viá»‡c nhÆ°ng thay vÃ¬ cháº¡y lá»‡nh npm run buildthÃ¬ nÃ³ cháº¡y npm run deploylá»‡nh triá»ƒn khai mÃ£.

TÃ³m láº¡i, mÃ£ nÃ y xÃ¡c Ä‘á»‹nh quy trÃ¬nh lÃ m viá»‡c Ä‘Æ°á»£c kÃ­ch hoáº¡t khi mÃ£ Ä‘Æ°á»£c Ä‘áº©y Ä‘áº¿n nhÃ¡nh main. Quy trÃ¬nh lÃ m viá»‡c cháº¡y cÃ¡c buildcÃ´ng testviá»‡c deploytheo thá»© tá»± Ä‘Ã³, má»—i cÃ´ng viá»‡c bao gá»“m má»™t loáº¡t cÃ¡c bÆ°á»›c Ä‘á»ƒ kiá»ƒm tra mÃ£, thiáº¿t láº­p mÃ´i trÆ°á»ng Node.js vÃ  cháº¡y cÃ¡c lá»‡nh cá»¥ thá»ƒ Ä‘á»ƒ xÃ¢y dá»±ng, kiá»ƒm tra vÃ  triá»ƒn khai mÃ£.

Pháº§n káº¿t luáº­n

TÃ³m láº¡i, GitHub Actions lÃ  má»™t ná»n táº£ng máº¡nh máº½ Ä‘á»ƒ tá»± Ä‘á»™ng hÃ³a quy trÃ¬nh phÃ¡t triá»ƒn pháº§n má»m cá»§a báº¡n.

NÃ³ cho phÃ©p báº¡n xÃ¡c Ä‘á»‹nh quy trÃ¬nh cÃ´ng viá»‡c tÃ¹y chá»‰nh Ä‘Æ°á»£c kÃ­ch hoáº¡t bá»Ÿi cÃ¡c sá»± kiá»‡n khÃ¡c nhau, cháº³ng háº¡n nhÆ° khi báº¡n Ä‘áº©y mÃ£ vÃ o kho lÆ°u trá»¯ hoáº·c khi ai Ä‘Ã³ má»Ÿ yÃªu cáº§u kÃ©o.

Báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ tá»± Ä‘á»™ng hÃ³a toÃ n bá»™ vÃ²ng Ä‘á»i phÃ¡t triá»ƒn pháº§n má»m cá»§a mÃ¬nh báº±ng GitHub Actions, tá»« viáº¿t vÃ  kiá»ƒm tra mÃ£ Ä‘áº¿n triá»ƒn khai vÃ o sáº£n xuáº¥t.

Báº¡n cÅ©ng cÃ³ thá»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng cÃ¡c hÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c xÃ¡c Ä‘á»‹nh trÆ°á»›c tá»« cá»™ng Ä‘á»“ng GitHub hoáº·c táº¡o cÃ¡c hÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng trong quy trÃ¬nh lÃ m viá»‡c cá»§a mÃ¬nh.

Báº±ng cÃ¡ch sá»­ dá»¥ng HÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng, báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ tiáº¿t kiá»‡m thá»i gian, cÃ´ng sá»©c vÃ  táº­p trung vÃ o cÃ¡c nhiá»‡m vá»¥ quan trá»ng hÆ¡n.

VÃ  Ä‘Ã³ lÃ  táº¥t cáº£ cho chá»§ Ä‘á» nÃ y. Cáº£m Æ¡n báº¡n Ä‘Ã£ Ä‘á»c.

Äá»c thÃªm

DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t sá»‘ tÃ i nguyÃªn cÃ³ thá»ƒ giÃºp báº¡n tÃ¬m hiá»ƒu vá» GitHub Actions:

  • TÃ i liá»‡u hÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng GitHub chÃ­nh thá»©c

  • Diá»…n Ä‘Ã n cá»™ng Ä‘á»“ng GitHub Actions

  • KÃªnh YouTube GitHub cÃ³ má»™t sá»‘ video vá» GitHub Actions.

  • GitHub Actions Marketplace cÃ³ má»™t táº­p há»£p cÃ¡c hÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c táº¡o sáºµn mÃ  báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng trong quy trÃ¬nh lÃ m viá»‡c cá»§a mÃ¬nh.

  • Github
Chapter 1

Tá»° Há»ŒC

Subsections of ABOUT THEMES

Chapter 1

Basics

Discover what this Hugo theme is all about and the core-concepts behind it.

Subsections of Basics

What's New

This document shows you what’s new in the latest release and flags it with one of the following badges. For a detailed list of changes, see the history page.

  • 0.112.4 The minimum required Hugo version.

  • Breaking A change that requires action by you after upgrading to assure the site is still functional.

  • Change A change in default behavior that may requires action by you if you want to revert it.

  • New Marks new behavior you might find interesting or comes configurable.

5.27.0.beta (XXXX-XX-XX)

  • New You now can scroll forward and backward thru all headings of a page by using ALT + ğŸ¡‘ and ALT + ğŸ¡“. This also works for the PRINT output format

  • New The breadcrumbs used in the topbar, search results and the taxonomy term lists are now using the pages frontmatter linktitle instead of title if set.

5.26.0 (2024-03-18)

  • New The lazy loading of images is now configurable by using the new lazy image effect. The default value hasn’t changed in comparison to older versions, you don’t need to change anything.

  • New It is now possible to adjust the max width of the main area, eg. in case you want to use the full page width for your content.

  • New Images and Codefences are now respecting Hugo’s Markdown attributes.

  • New The theme has updated its Mermaid dependency to 10.6.0. This adds support for block diagrams.

  • New This release fixes a long outstanding bug where the page wasn’t repositioning correctly when going forward or backward in your browser history.

5.25.0 (2024-02-29)

  • Change This release deprecates the attachments shortcode in favor of the new the resources shortcode.

    If you are using Hugo below 0.123.0, you don’t need to change anything as the old shortcode still works (but may generate warnings).

    Anyways, users are strongly advised to migrate as the attachments shortcode will not receive support anymore. Migration instructions are listed on the attachments shortcode page.

  • Change If you run Hugo with GitInfo configured, the default page footer now prints out name, email address and date of the last commit. If you want to turn this off you either have to run Hugo without GitInfo (which is the default) or overwrite the content-footer.html partial.

5.24.0 (2024-02-28)

  • 0.112.4 This release requires a newer Hugo version.

  • Change The topbar button received a way to add text next to the icon. For this, the original title option was renamed to hint while the new title option is now displayed next to the icon.

  • Change The frontmatter option menuTitle is now deprecated in favor for Hugo’s own linkTitle. You don’t need to change anything as the old menuTitle option is still supported.

  • Change The light themes have a bit more contrast for content text and headings. Also the syntaxhighlighting was changed to the more colorful MonokaiLight. This brings the syntaxhighlightning in sync with the corresponding dark theme variants, which are using Monokai. If you dislike this, you can create your own color variant file as described here.

  • New If the theme can not resolve a link to a page or image, you can now generate warnings or errors during build by setting link.errorlevel or image.errorlevel to either warning or error in your hugo.toml respectively. By default this condition is silently ignored and the link is written as-is.

    Please note that a page link will generate false negatives if uglyURLs=true and it references an ordinary page before 0.123.0.

    Please note that an image link will generate false negatives if the file resides in your static directory.

  • New You now can configure additional options for every theme variant in your hugo.toml. This allows for optional advanced functionality. You don’t need to change anything as the old configuration options will still work (but may generate warnings now).

    The advanced functionality allows you to set an explicit name for a theme variant and now allows for multiple auto mode variants that adjust to the light/dark preference of your OS settings.

  • New New partial for defining the heading. See documentation for further reading.

  • New Support for Hugo’s built-in figure shortcode.

  • New On taxonomy and term pages you can now use prev/next navigation as within the normal page structure.

  • New In additiion to the existing menu width customization, it is now also possible to set the width of the menu flyout for small screen sizes with the --MENU-WIDTH-S CSS property.

  • New Improvements for accessibility when tabbing thru the page for images, links and tab handles.

  • New The editURL config parameter is now overwritable in your pages frontmatter. In addition it received more versatility by letting you control where to put the file path into the URL. This is achieved by replacing the variable ${FilePath} in your URL by the pages file path. You don’t need to change anything in your existing configuration as the old way without the replacement variable still works.

  • New The themes config and frontmatter options received a comprehensive documentation update. In addition the theme switched from config.toml to hugo.toml.

  • New Restored compatibility with Hugo versions 0.121.0 or higher for the highlight shortcode. This does not change the minimum required Hugo version.

  • New Restored compatibility with Hugo versions 0.123.0 or higher for theme specific output formats and handling of taxonomy and term titles. This does not change the minimum required Hugo version.

5.23.0 (2023-11-03)

  • Change With 0.120.0 the author settings move into the [params] array in your hugo.toml. Because this collides with the previous way, the theme expected author information, it now adheres to Hugo standards and prints out a warning during built if something is wrong.

    Change your previous setting from

    hugo.
    [params]
  author = 'Hugo'
    params:
  author: Hugo
    {
   "params": {
      "author": "Hugo"
   }
}

    to

    hugo.
    [params]
  [params.author]
    name = 'Hugo'
    params:
  author:
    name: Hugo
    {
   "params": {
      "author": {
         "name": "Hugo"
      }
   }
}

  • Change Taxonomy term pages now add the breadcrumb for each listed page. If this gets too crowded for you, you can turn the breadcrumbs off in your hugo.toml by adding disableTermBreadcrumbs=true.

  • New Taxonomy and term pages are now allowed to contain content. This is added inbetween the title and the page list.

  • New It is now possible to print custom taxonomies anywhere in your page. See the docs.

  • New It is now possible to adjust the menu width for your whole site. See the docs.

  • New This release adds social media meta tags for the Open Graph protocol and Twitter Cards to your site. See the docs.

  • New This release comes with additional sort options for the menu and the children shortcode. Both will now accept the following values: weight, title, linktitle, modifieddate, expirydate, publishdate, date, length or default (adhering to Hugo’s default sort order).

  • New The theme now provides a mechanism to load further JavaScript dependencies defined by you only if it is needed. This comes in handy if you want to add own shortcodes that depend on additional JavaScript code to be loaded. See the docs.

  • New The theme has updated its Mermaid dependency to 10.6.0. This adds support for the xychart type.

  • New This release adds portable Markdown links.

    Previously it was not possible to use pure Markdown links in a configuration independend way to link to pages inside of your project. It always required you to know how your uglyURLs setting is, wheather you link to a page or page bundle and in case of relative links if your current page is a page or page bundle. (eg. [generator](generator/index.html) vs. [generator](generator.html)). This is a hassle as you have to change these links manually once you change your uglyURLs setting or change the type of a page.

    You could work around this by using the relref shortcode (eg [generator]({{% relref "../generator" %}})) which works but results in non-portable Markdown.

    Now it’s possible to use the same path of a call to relref in a plain Markdown link (eg [generator](../generator)). This is independend of any configuration settings or the page types involved in linking. Note, that this requires your links to be given without any extension, so [generator](generator/index.html) will work as before.

    The following types of linking are supported:

    link description
    [generator](en/basics/generator) absolute from your project root (multilang)
    [generator](/en/basics/generator) absolute from your project root (multilang)
    [generator](basics/generator) absolute from your current language root
    [generator](/basics/generator) absolute from your current language root
    [generator](./../generator) relative from the current page
    [generator](../generator) relative from the current page

5.22.0 (2023-10-02)

  • Change This release fixes an issue where in unfortunate conditions DOM ids generated by Hugo may collide with DOM ids set by the theme. To avoid this, all theme DOM ids are now prefixed with R-.

    If you haven’t modified anything, everything is fine. Otherwise you have to check your custom CSS rules and JavaScript code.

  • Change You can now have structural sections in the hierarchical menu without generating a page for it.

    This can come in handy, if content for such a section page doesn’t make much sense to you. See the documentation for how to do this.

    This feature may require you to make changes to your existing installation if you are already using shortcuts to pages inside of your project with a headless branch parent.

    In this case it is advised to remove the title from the headless branch parent’s frontmatter, as it will otherwise appear in your breadcrumbs.

  • New It is now possible to overwrite the setting for collapsibleMenu of your hugo.toml inside of a page’s frontmatter.

  • New If a Mermaid graph is zoomable a button to reset the view is now added to the upper right corner. The button is only shown once the mouse is moved over the graph.

  • New It is now possible to remove the root breadcrumb by setting disableRootBreadcrumb=true in your hugo.toml.

  • New The output of the dedicated search page now displays the result’s breadcrumb.

  • New Table rows now change their background color on every even row.

  • New Translation into Swahili. This language is not supported for search.

5.21.0 (2023-09-18)

  • Change We made changes to the menu footer to improve alignment with the menu items in most cases. Care was taken not to break your existing overwritten footer. Anyways, if you have your menu-footer.html partial overridden, you may want to review the styling (eg. margins/paddings) of your partial.

  • New This release comes with an awesome new feature, that allows you to customize your topbar buttons, change behavior, reorder them or define entirely new ones, unique to your installation. See the documentation for further details.

  • New The theme has updated its Swagger dependency to 5.7.2 for the openapi shortcode. This brings support for OpenAPI Specification 3.1.

5.20.0 (2023-08-26)

  • Change The theme has updated its Swagger dependency to 5.4.1 for the openapi shortcode.

    With this comes a change in the light theme variants of Relearn Bright, Relearn Light and Zen Light by switching the syntaxhighlightning inside of openapi to a light scheme. This brings it more in sync with the code style used by the theme variants itself.

    Additionally, the syntaxhighlightning inside of openapi for printing was switched to a light scheme for all theme variants.

    If you dislike this change, you can revert this in your theme variants CSS by adding

    --OPENAPI-CODE-theme: obsidian;
--PRINT-OPENAPI-CODE-theme: obsidian;

  • Change For consistency reasons, we renamed the CSS variable --MENU-SECTION-HR-color to --MENU-SECTION-SEPARATOR-color. You don’t need to change anything in your custom color stylesheet as the old name will be used as a fallback.

  • New The theme variants Zen Light and Zen Dark now add more contrast between menu, topbar and content by adding thin borders.

    Those borders are now configurable by using the CSS variables --MAIN-TOPBAR-BORDER-color, --MENU-BORDER-color, --MENU-TOPBAR-BORDER-color, --MENU-TOPBAR-SEPARATOR-color, --MENU-HEADER-SEPARATOR-color and --MENU-SECTION-ACTIVE-CATEGORY-BORDER-color.

    For existing variants nothing has changed visually.

  • New The default values for the image effects are now configurable for your whole site via hugo.toml or for each page thru frontmatter.

  • New This release fixes a long outstanding bug where Mermaid graphs could not be displayed if they were initially hidden - like in collapsed expand or inactive tabs.

  • New Restored compatibility with Hugo versions lower than 0.111.0 for the highlight shortcode. This does not change the minimum required Hugo version.

5.19.0 (2023-08-12)

  • New The highlight shortcode now accepts the new parameter title. This displays the code like a single tab. This is also available using codefences and makes it much easier to write nicer code samples.

  • New The theme has added two new color variants zen-light and zen-dark. Check it out!

  • New The theme now dispatches the custom event themeVariantLoaded on the document when the variant is fully loaded either initially or by switching the variant manually with the variant selector.

  • New The theme has updated its Mermaid dependency to 10.3.1. This adds support for the sankey diagram type and now comes with full support for YAML inside Mermaid graphs (previously, the theme ignored explicit Mermaid theme settings in YAML).

  • New Translation into Hungarian.

5.18.0 (2023-07-27)

  • Change The theme adds additional warnings for deprecated or now unsupported features.

  • Change There are visual improvements in displaying text links in your content aswell as to some other clickable areas in the theme. If you’ve overwritten some theme styles in your own CSS, keep this in mind.

  • New Restored compatibility with Hugo 0.95.0 or higher. This does not change the minimum required Hugo version.

  • New The siteparam shortcode is now capable in displaying nested params aswell as supporting text formatting.

5.17.0 (2023-06-22)

  • Change The default behavior for the copy-to-clipboard feature for code blocks has changed.

    The copy-to-clipboard button for code blocks will now only be displayed if the reader hovers the code block.

    If you dislike this new behavior you can turn it off and revert to the old behavior by adding [params] disableHoverBlockCopyToClipBoard=true to your hugo.toml.

  • New Restored compatibility with Hugo 0.114.0 or higher. This does not change the minimum required Hugo version.

  • New The new highlight shortcode replaces Hugo’s default implementation and is fully compatible. So you don’t need to change anything.

    In addition it offers some extensions. Currently only the wrap extension option is provided to control whether a code block should be wrapped or scrolled if to long to fit.

5.16.0 (2023-06-10)

  • Change The theme now provides warnings for deprecated or now unsupported features. The warnings include hints how to fix them and an additional link to the documentation.

    DEPRECATION warnings mark features that still work but may be removed in the future.

    UNSUPPORTED warnings mark features that will not work anymore.

  • Change The 404 error page was revamped. Hopefully you will not see this very often.

  • New The tabs shortcode and the tab shortcode received some love and now align with their style, color, title and icon parameter to the other shortcodes.

    The visuals are now slightly different compared to previous versions. Most noteable, if you now display a single code block in a tab, its default styling will adapt to that of a code block but with a tab handle at the top.

    Additionally the name parameter was renamed to title but you don’t need to change anything yet as the old name will be used as a fallback. Nevertheless you will get deprecation warnings while executing Hugo.

  • New The theme now optionally supports separate favicons for light & dark mode.

5.15.0 (2023-05-29)

  • Change Restored compatibility with Hugo 0.112.0 or higher. This does not change the minimum required Hugo version.

    The attachments shortcode has compatibility issues with newer Hugo versions. You must switch to leaf bundles or are locked to Hugo < 0.112.0 for now.

    It is planned to refactor the attchments shortcode in the future. This will make it possible to use the shortcode in branch bundles again but not in simple pages anymore. This will most likely come with a breaking change.

  • Change The tabs shortcode has changed behavior if you haven’t set the groupid parameter.

    Formerly all tab views without a groupid were treated as so they belong to the same group. Now, each tab view is treated as it was given a unique id.

  • New The already known tabshas a new friend the tab shortcode to make it easier to create a tab view in case you only need one single tab. Really handy if you want to flag your code examples with a language identifier.

    Additionally for such a use case, the whitespace between a tab outline and the code is removed if only a single code block is contained.

  • New Besides the tag taxonomy the theme now also provides the category taxonomy out of the box and shows them in the content footer of each page.

5.14.0 (2023-05-20)

  • New The taxonomy pages received some love in this release, making them better leverage available screen space and adding translation support for the taxonomy names.

    Hugo’s default taxonmies tags and categories are already contained in the theme’s i18n files. If you have self-defined taxonomies, you can add translations by adding them to your own i18n files. If you don’t provide translations, the singualar and plural forms are taken as configured in your hugo.toml.

  • New To give you more flexibility in customizing your article layout a new partial content-header.html is introduced.

    This came out of the requirement to customize the position of article tags, which by default are displayed above the title. A second requirement was to also show additional taxonomies not supported by the theme natively. While Hugo supports tags and categories by default, the theme only displays tags.

    So how to adjust the position of tags starting from the theme’s default where tags are only shown above the title?

    1. Hide tags above title: Overwrite content-header.html with an empty file.
    2. Show tags between title and content: Overwrite heading-post.html and add {{ partial "tags.html" . }} to it.
    3. Show tags below content: Overwrite content-footer.html and add {{ partial "tags.html" . }} to it.

  • New The new parameter breadcrumbSeparator is now available in your hugo.toml to change the - well - separator of the breadcrumb items. An appropriate default is in place if you do not configure anything.

5.13.0 (2023-05-17)

  • Change The swagger shortcode was deprecated in favor for the openapi shortcode. You don’t need to change anything yet as the old name will be used as a fallback. It is planned to remove the swagger shortcode in the next major release.

    Additionally, the implemantion of this shortcode was switched from RapiDoc to SwaggerUI.

5.12.0 (2023-05-04)

  • Change In the effort to comply with WCAG standards, the implementation of the collapsible menu was changed (again). While Internet Explorer 11 has issues in displaying it, the functionality still works.

  • New Support for the great VSCode Front Matter extension which provides on-premise CMS capabilties to Hugo.

    The theme provides Front Matter snippets for its shortcodes. Currently only English and German is supported. Put a reference into your frontmatter.json like this

    ​
    {
  ...
  "frontMatter.extends": [
      "./vscode-frontmatter/snippets.en.json"
  ]
  ...
}

  • New Support for languages that are written right to left (like Arabic) is now complete and extended to the menu, the top navigation bar and print. You can experience this in the pirate translation. This feature is not available in Internet Explorer 11.

  • New The scrollbars are now colored according to their variant color scheme to better fit into the visuals.

5.11.0 (2023-02-07)

  • Change The theme removed the popular jQuery library from its distribution.

    In case you made changes to the theme that are dependend on this library you can place a copy of jQuery into your static/js directory and load it from your own layouts/partials/custom-header.html like this:

    ​
    <script src="{{"js/jquery.min.js"| relURL}}" defer></script>

  • Change Mermaid diagrams can now be configured for pan and zoom on site-, page-level or individually for each graph.

    The default setting of on, in effect since 1.1.0, changed back to off as there was interference with scrolling on mobile and big pages.

  • Change The theme is now capable to visually adapt to your OS’s light/dark mode setting.

    This is also the new default setting if you haven’t configured themeVariant in your hugo.toml.

    Additionally you can configure the variants to be taken for light/dark mode with the new themeVariantAuto parameter.

    This is not supported for Internet Explorer 11, which still displays in the relearn-light variant.

  • Change The JavaScript code for handling image lightboxes (provided by Featherlight) was replaced by a CSS-only solution.

    This also changed the lightbox effects parameter from featherlight=false to lightbox=false. Nevertheless you don’t need to change anything as the old name will be used as a fallback.

  • Change In the effort to comply with WCAG standards, the implementation of the expand shortcode was changed. While Internet Explorer 11 has issues in displaying it, the functionality still works.

  • New Translation into Czech. This language is not supported for search.

  • New GitHub releases are also now tagged for the main version (eg. 1.2.x), major version (eg. 1.x) and the latest (just x) release making it easier for you to pin the theme to a certain version.

5.10.0 (2023-01-25)

  • New The attachments, badge, button and notice shortcodes have a new parameter color to set arbitrary CSS color values.

    Additionally the --ACCENT-color brand color introduced in version 5.8.0 is now supported with these shortcodes.

5.9.0 (2022-12-23)

  • Breaking With this version it is now possible to not only have sections on the first menu level but also pages.

    It was later discovered, that this causes pages only meant to be displayed in the More section of the menu and stored directly inside your content directory to now show up in the menu aswell.

    To get rid of this undesired behavior you have two choices:

    1. Make the page file a headless branch bundle (contained in its own subdirectory and called _index.md) and add the following frontmatter configuration to the file (see exampleSite’s content/showcase/_index.en.md). This causes its content to not be ontained in the sitemap.

      ​
      +++
title = 'Showcase'

[_build]
  list = 'never'
  publishResources = true
  render = 'always'
+++
      ---
_build:
  list: never
  publishResources: true
  render: always
title: Showcase
---
      {
   "_build": {
      "list": "never",
      "publishResources": true,
      "render": "always"
   },
   "title": "Showcase"
}

    2. Store the page file for below a parent headless branch bundle and add the following frontmatter to he parent (see exampleSite’s content/more/_index.en.md). Don’t give this page a title as this will cause it to be shown in the breadcrumbs - a thing you most likely don’t want.

      ​
      +++
[_build]
  list = 'never'
  publishResources = false
  render = 'never'
+++
      ---
_build:
  list: never
  publishResources: false
  render: never
---
      {
   "_build": {
      "list": "never",
      "publishResources": false,
      "render": "never"
   }
}

      In this case, the file itself can be a branch bundle, leaf bundle or simple page (see exampleSite’s content/more/credits.en.md). This causes its content to be contained in the sitemap.

      ​
      +++
title = 'Credits'
+++
      ---
title: Credits
---
      {
   "title": "Credits"
}

  • Change The required folder name for the attachments shortcode was changed for leaf bundles.

    Previously, the attachments for leaf bundles in non-multilang setups were required to be in a files subdirectory. For page bundles and leaf bundles in multilang setups they were always required to be in a _index.<LANGCODE>.files or index.<LANGCODE>.files subdirectory accordingly.

    This added unnecessary complexity. So attachments for leaf bundles in non-multilang setups can now also reside in a index.files directory. Although the old files directory is now deprecated, if both directories are present, only the old files directory will be used for compatibility.

  • Change Absolute links prefixed with http:// or https:// are now opened in a separate browser tab.

    You can revert back to the old behavior by defining externalLinkTarget="_self" in the params section of your hugo.toml.

  • New The theme now supports Hugo’s module system.

5.8.0 (2022-12-08)

  • New The new badge shortcode is now available to add highly configurable markers to your content as you can see it on this page.

  • New The new icon shortcode simplyfies the usage of icons. This can even be combined with also new badge shortcode.

  • New The theme now supports some of GFM (GitHub Flavored Markdown) syntax and Hugo Markdown extensions, namely task lists, defintion lists and footnotes.
